items.content:
Video Software Engineer - Video Workflows - REMOTE position

***For immediate consideration, please contact John Boyle at or

You will be joining the horizontal and cross functional team responsible for supporting all-thing-video for Client Digital, which includes development, oversight, and coordination of our video workflows, playback and data. We are looking of a video expert that can help us drive the evolution of our ecosystem who is familiar with industry's current state that can be ready to get hands-on the first day.

Responsibilities

  • Creating industry leading digital video solutions that provide the highest technical quality, lighting-fast performance and engaging experience across all Company Digital properties.
  • Delivering live and on demand video streams for all our platforms.
  • Delivering video players that provide the best experience to our users, considering the form factor, device and network connectivity.
  • Creating and maintaining video workflows and data tools that support an efficient and authoritative delivery of video assets and metadata.
  • Maintaining and lead a video product roadmap across all product lines.
  • Set organization-wide experience and technical video standards.
  • Support our product teams to integrate video into their end products.
  • Coordinate across the organization teams involved in the video delivery chain, including Editorial, Production, Ads, Product, Design, and Technology.
  • Serve as subject-matter resource for current and future state and trends in the digital video landscape.
  • Implement monitoring tools for video and workflow infrastructure.
  • Designs of video workflows for publishing, metadata, encoding and delivery for live and video on demand.
  • Develop APIs to provide video metadata to support content management systems, analytics, and client-side players.
  • Consult with product and technology teams for the implementation and troubleshooting of video solutions.

Qualifications
  • 3+ years of experience working on streaming video products.
  • Experience with video streaming standards, e.g. HLS, CMAF, FMP4, MPEG-DASH.
  • Experience with audio and video codecs and protection technologies (DRM), e.g. H.264/AVC, H.265/HEVC, AAC, Fairplay, Widevine.
  • Experience with Dynamic Ad Insertion technologies, e.g. CSAI, SSAI, VAST, MOAT.
  • Experience with backend programing in NodeJS and NoSQL databases.
  • Experience with video tools, e.g. Media validators and QC tools, FFMPEG.
  • Experience working on video back-end data and workflow applications.
  • Experience with CDN and Video Cloud Services, e.g. AWS, Akamai, iStreamPlanet.
  • Demonstrated advanced understanding of troubleshooting, root-cause analysis, application design, solution development, human factors/usability design, and implementation of projects for major business units or the enterprise.
  • Advanced Computer Science degree or comparable experience.
#LI-JB02 - provided by Dice

Job description

User Research International is a research company based out of Redmond, Washington. Working with some of the biggest companies in the industry, we aim to improve your experience via paid research studies. Whether it be the latest video game or productivity tools, we value your feedback and experience.We are currently conducting a research study called The Kubernetes Editor study. We are looking for current full-time developers who are familiar with the IDE IntelliJ and Kubernetes. This study is a one time remote study via an online meeting. We’re offering $200 for participation in this study. Session lengths are 2 hours. These studies provide a platform for our researchers to receive feedback for an existing or upcoming products. We have included the survey link for the study below. Taking the survey will help determine if you fit the profile requirements. If you complete the survey, and you are actually a fit to the study's requirements, URI will follow up with you. I have summarized the study details below. Thank you!Study: The Kubernetes Editor StudyGratuity: $200 SessionLength: 2 hours Location: Remote via an online meetingDates: July-August. Apply now

items.content:
Visual Designer at RaiseMe

Remote | Freelance

Job Description

Visual Designer

San Francisco, CA

San Francisco or remote

This is a contract role with the possibility to convert to full-time.

Who are we?

At RaiseMe, we imagine a world where every student has an opportunity to realize their college and career ambitions, and we believe that expanded access to education is the foundation of that future. By partnering with colleges to offer incremental “micro-scholarships” to reward students individual academic and extracurricular progress throughout high school, we aim to empower millions of students to build their personal path to college, while making paying for it clearer and more transparent. More than 1.8 million students have earned micro-scholarships for college on RaiseMe to-date, and we’ve only just begun.

Our team is made up of a group of scrappy, creative, solution-oriented thinkers and doers who are passionate about transforming students’ paths to higher education for the better.

Responsibilities

The ideal candidate is a creative, solution-oriented visual designer with 4+ years of experience working cross-functionally to produce high impact creative assets, and a desire to work in social responsibility and solve problems in higher education.

What will you do?

  • You will be a key figure in shaping the direction of brand design for a rapidly growing organization. You will contribute creative solutions to communicate complex ideas in compelling and effective digital and print formats.
  • Design, develop and maintain branded templates including website, slide decks, sales enablement collateral, print brochures and posters, case studies, whitepapers, infographics, HTML emails, email signatures, advertisements and event/trade show signage among others.
  • Take ideas from concept to execution: use a startup mindset and full range of visual design skills to support every aspect of the creative production process, ranging from ideation to launch.
  • Work with a talented design team consisting of designers from LinkedIn and Google and partner with the marketing team and other relevant stakeholders to support the development and maturation of RaiseMe’s brand identity and vision.
  • Develop visual solutions for a broad range of materials aimed at a variety of target audiences.
  • You will apply your expertise in building out brand guidelines and component library guidelines to help shape our visual brand as represented across channels.

Who are you?

  • You have 4+ years of extensive experience design and illustration experience creating high quality, compelling creative digital and print assets for brands.
  • You are proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign) and Sketch (required); After Effects and Premiere Pro a plus.
  • You enjoy designing marketing materials across multiple formats and delivery channels and screen sizes (mobile, tablet, and desktop), print, video, large format, experiential, social media, etc.
  • You are excited about building the visual identity for a brand to engage a wide range of audiences, including high school and college students, parents, educators, and higher education administrators.
  • You possess a working knowledge of CSS3, HTML5 and JavaScript.
  • You have experience working with brand guidelines and have the skills to work creatively within existing guidelines and help to shape brand identity.
  • You have excellent oral and written communication as well as presentation skills
  • You have strong time management capabilities and can tackle multiple projects of varying scopes from start to finish to meet both stakeholder and deadline expectations.
  • You have the ability to receive and apply constructive criticism from peers and clients.
  • You have a working knowledge of digital design best practices and keep up-to-date on design trends.
  • You work well in a collaborative team environment while demonstrating independent initiative and follow-through in accepting and applying feedback from stakeholders.
  • Familiarity with user interface design a plus
  • Experience in video editing and production a plus

What are the other benefits?

Be a part of the storyline in the evolution of a fast-growth social impact organization. Join a highly collaborative and cross-functional team within a growing startup. Have an impact on the business and help build the future of ed-tech. Go to work every day knowing that you’re building brand for a product that will narrow the achievement gap and enable more students to achieve their college and career ambitions.

Apply for job

items.title: Brand Design Lead
items.content:
Brand Design Lead at DuckDuckGo

Remote | Freelance | International
  • Paoli, PA
  • Contracted to Full Time
  • Experienced

We are a diverse team from around the world, on a mission to make DuckDuckGo the company people trust most with their online privacy, and we want your help!

Join our team as a Brand Design Lead, who is up for the challenge to lead and transform the DuckDuckGo brand experience across all of our products.

As part of our growing Design Team, you will be collaborating with team members at all levels to shape how we communicate our brand throughout the entire experience — from marketing to our search engine and privacy tools.

Using your hands-on branding skills, you will lead the entire design process of your projects, from ideation to execution. You will have a voice in all product decisions, both big and small, and an opportunity to leverage our approach to design (which you can read more about at: https://spreadprivacy.com/ethical-by-design/).

We are fully remote and seek to empower our team to be self-directed and self-motivated in their projects. If that seems awesome and you like the idea of our core values — build trust, question assumptions, and validate direction — you’ll fit right in!

What you will do:

  • Champion the evolution of our brand language, that speaks to our mission and creates a strong and recognizable brand.
  • Lead and advise projects showcasing our brand and retaining a consistent brand message across multiple platforms: product, print, partner communication, events, advertising, and soft goods.
  • Define how our brand is applied throughout both Marketing and Product in our design system.
  • Mentor and provide creative direction to others, raising understanding of design’s role across the organization.
  • Carry ideas forward with discretion and little direction.
  • Collaborate cross-functionally to create impactful work that is informed by data and user feedback.
  • Engage in critique, humbly defending your work, and being transparent with your process.

What we are looking for:

  • Demonstrable strengths and hands-on experience in brand design, typography, color, and composition, having led the branding efforts for at least one large software or digital product.
  • Proficiency with current industry design tools needed to carry out brand work.
  • Prior experience in leadership level design positions and willingness to mentor other designers.
  • Ability to provide creative direction and lead difficult brand conversations with discretion and little direction.
  • Understanding of design systems and their impact across product and marketing.
  • Ability to collaborate in defining and evolving brand messaging, actively representing the brand voice and vision.
  • Ability to write creative briefs that define and communicate project goals with stakeholders.
  • Effective project management ability, paired with exceptional communication skills.
  • Experience working with qualitative user research.

Other things to know:

  • While we leverage specific job titles for hiring purposes, we do not use them internally. Instead, we follow our own professional levels, with expectations for each level clearly defined across several dimensions.
  • We are a small, remote team distributed across time zones, and we rely on a variety of communication tools throughout the day.
  • Sometimes we meet up! Expect to travel at least two times a year: once for our all-hands meetup and again for a team retreat (each ~4-5 days).
  • We believe in a focused approach to collaboration, where individual team members work on a single top priority at a time, each supporting larger, company-wide objectives. This philosophy serves to impact our vision to raise the standard of trust online.
  • Our work philosophy centers on empowered project management. All team members have opportunities to run projects.
  • Transparency supports individual and team success at DuckDuckGo. We encourage everyone to participate in areas of interest throughout the company. Anyone and everyone can (and should) ask questions and offer feedback about our products and internal projects.
  • We aim to exemplify our values (build trust, question assumptions, and validate direction) in everything we do.
  • While this is a full-time job, we offer a flexible work arrangement with no core hours, expecting an average commitment of 40 hours per week.
  • We support professional development of our team members through career advisory and a learning stipend, reinforcing our culture of growth and skill-building.

DuckDuckGo does not work with any recruiting agencies or services. Instead, we work with each candidate one-on-one throughout a unique hiring process that we’ve built to reflect our company culture.

DuckDuckGo provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment, and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

If you think you might thrive in this environment, we would love to hear from you. Use the application to apply!

Apply for job

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=2, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
UI Design Specialization Mentor at CareerFoundry

Remote | Freelance | International
  • Mentor Team
  • Remote job

We created CareerFoundry to help others build their careers while maintaining personal freedom and flexibility. Our 100% online, flexible, mentor-driven courses are setting the standard for globally accessible technical education.

CareerFoundry has recently developed a specialized course teaching UI basics to UX Designers. The course will be for design professionals with an interest in developing UI skills. Youll be working alongside students to help them complete a project-based online course.

Our global pool of over 90 mentors and tutors in the web development, iOS mobile development, user experience design, and user interface design fields has grown to include freelancers, entrepreneurs, consultants, and agency directors who passionately guide, motivate, and empower our students to create new careers in the tech industry. We are constantly searching for more teaching enthusiasts like you to join this pool.

Your Mission

  • You are passionate about sharing your knowledge and experience, supporting students on their way to becoming UX designers who specialize in UI design. We are looking for mentors/teachers who are interested in mentoring students from all over the globe all online.
  • You have several years experience in UI design as well as experience in UX design, with a demonstrable track record showcasing your work for a variety of clients and companies.
  • You can show a first class portfolio with rock solid, relevant references to back it up. Ideally, you will already have gained experience in teaching or you have the right attitude and skills for it: you have time and patience for beginners and a strong desire to guide people along their career path in this field, with knowledge of the latest design tools, a broad network of experts in the field and an in-depth understanding of industry practices.

What’s in it for you:

  • Apart from the sheer joy of working independently and remotely, there’s also
  • Generous compensation and flexible working hours
  • The thrill of helping people around the world change their lives and cultivate a career they love
  • Ongoing professional networking opportunities

Mentors work on a freelance contract with CareerFoundry and are remunerated for portfolio reviews, coaching calls with students, and the occasional coaching call with their tutor partner.

What were looking for:

  • Minimum of 5 years of professional experience in the tech industry
  • Experience in UX design and UI design, with portfolio to prove it
  • Mastery of UX and UI design principles, methodologies, and processes
  • Proficient in prototyping and wireframing responsive designs
  • Comfortable using the required tools (i.e. Adobe Suite and Sketch)
  • Previous experience in mentoring / teaching, preferably online
  • Experience in working remotely
Apply for job

items.title: Olark: Marketing Visual Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=16, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
Marketing Visual Designer

You probably haven’t run into a company like Olark before. We are a small, fully distributed team working to make business more human. Since 2009, we’ve been in the live chat business, helping tens of thousands of customers support their customers with our chatbox. 

We believe that customer service is essential to all types of businesses including our own business - which is reflected in our All Hands Support model. Our passion and dedication to our customers is a direct result of us putting our people first. 

This is a unique point in our company history. As we move into our tenth year of business, we are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Marketing Visual Designer to play an essential role in using visual communications to generate demand and sales for Olark products, and help drive forward our brand platform.

If you are excited about branding, digital ads, website & email design, taking our visual style and communications to a new level while playing an instrumental role in Olark’s next phase of growth — reaching thousands more small businesses — we’d love to talk to you. 

Note: this is a fully remote position. You can be based anywhere in the United States or Canada.

Expectations for this position: 
  • Creating an incredible first impression: This position is for a marketing visual designer on our marketing team, to focus on creating an excellent first impression of Olark and increasing our customer base. You’ll collaborate with members of our marketing and design teams, creating visual concepts to communicate ideas that inspire, inform, and captivate our customers. 
  • Representing our brand: Building Olark’s brand through innovative and consistent development and application of our style guides is essential for building trust and growing our reputation. Each of our products exist to help small teams listen, learn and improve to make their business grow in a more human way. You’ll work to push our brand forward creatively and responsibly, knowing when to use our style guides and when to build on them. 
  • Delivering excellent design across varied projects:  Your design challenges may include: developing original imagery for our website & social media posts, designing targeted email campaigns, providing layout support for our guides & blog articles, creating advertisements & banners, designs for webinars, demos and events, designing promotional swag, motion animation for social media, and transforming data into beautiful infographics. You’ll have a high degree of flexibility to try new visual communication methods that will help us achieve our business goals.
  • Putting the customer first: Like everyone at Olark, you’ll strive to understand and empathize with our users, and put them at the heart of your design process and new concept ideation.

You: 
  • Strategic thinker who can focus on details: You are able to zoom out to develop the right plans and zoom in to execute your plans well.  
  • Excellent organizational and project management skills: You have the ability to manage a wide range of topics and projects at one time.
  • Self-directed, but also open to collaboration: You are happy to work independently, but know when to ask for help. You know how to give, and receive, direct feedback. You are a team player, comfortable both contributing to and leading projects. You see ambiguity as an opportunity to experiment. 
  • Excellent communicator: You are able to clearly communicate your thoughts, especially in text based and visual communication. You know when a conversation should be in chat, video, or face-to-face. 
  • Rigorously Creative: You’ll maintain a high-level of aesthetic quality across projects.  You are able to take complex design challenges and develop fresh, creative solutions.
  • Empathetic: You realize listening is just as important as speaking your mind. You assume good faith of your teammates when there is conflict and are curious about understanding their perspectives.  
  • Comfortable working remotely: Our team is distributed and you’ll communicate via remote tools: we use Gmail, Slack, JIRA, Zoom, Sketch, Craft, and Invision. 
  • Value time: You’ll ensure that things are getting done on time and within scope. You’ll work to set expectations clearly at the beginning of each project.

Your experience: 
  • Important: we'll need to see your portfolio site, so be sure to include a URL when applying. 
  • 5+ years of design experience, agency experience a plus
  • Excellent visual design skills, including an eye for typography, composition, and use of color; Illustration skills a plus
  • Mastery of visual design software (Photoshop/Illustrator/Sketch)
  • Ability to collaborate with design and marketing teams
  • Ability to take creative direction and constructive criticism
  • A bonus: Ability to implement your web designs & animations with basic HTML/CSS

You will help us solve key Marketing challenges:
  • Use the power of marketing creative design to transform Olark’s external market and customer communications to drive new business.
  • Be instrumental in pushing Olark’s brand forward to help us achieve our strategic goals and vision for the company

You can expect a lot from us: 
First off, make sure to read about our team culture at olark.com/jobs, and our values at olark.com/values. Beyond what you see there, as a member of the Marketing team you can expect:
  • A great remote culture and team: Even though we’re remote, our team makes the effort to connect to one another and we provide in person opportunities to further enhance that bond. We genuinely like each other.  
  • Weekly required Marketing meetings, 1-on-1 manager meetings, and team wide sync.
  • A life outside of work: Olarkers generally work 40 hour weeks. Work is a marathon, not a sprint.  We are building a company for the long haul.  
  • Great compensation and benefits: competitive pay, phone/internet stipend, health benefits, paid parental leave, annual $1K vacation bonus, 401k, and charitable donation matching.

Olark is committed to diversity in its workforce. Olark is an equal employment opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants without regard to gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, race, veteran or disability status.

items.content:
UX/UI Designer

Who we are:
Fun and lean design agency

What we are looking for:
UX/UI designer for full-time remote contract role. Salary is 3-4K a month with lots of room to grow. 

Type of work:
  • Informational sites
  • Parallax sites
  • Mobile Apps
  • Complex web apps
  • Wireframing + Prototypes (Holla @ Invision!)

What you need to bring to the table:

  • Be able to work during our business hours (9am to 5pm PST).
  • Be available throughout the day via slack/email/etc.
  • Four or more years of UX/UI design experience and a portfolio to back it up.
  • Wizard with Sketch + Photoshop.
  • Ability to create clickable prototypes using InVision.
  • Experience with Basecamp to post and collaborate on projects.
  • Extensive experience in using UX/UI design best practices to design solutions and a deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design.
  • Ability to iterate designs and solutions efficiently, quickly, and intelligently.  

Big bonus if you can:

  • Have some print design chops working in Illustrator + indesign 
  • Basic knowledge of front end code (HTML. CSS, etc)

If you like what you see and want to get out of that commute...sendt us your portfolio, resume, and seriously... a funny or interesting cover page!

items.title: Senior Designer, Brand Design
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=16, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=3}
items.content:
Senior Designer, Brand Design at Vox Media

Remote

Location: NY, DC, SF, LA, Remote

Vox Media is the leading independent modern media company. Known for building the best media brands and the technology that enables them, we are committed to building a better future for the industry and getting the future of media right. Vox Media’s editorial networks include Vox, The Verge, SB Nation, Eater, Polygon, Recode, and Curbed. Our diverse storytelling and advertising businesses include the Concert publisher-led marketplace, the Vox Creative brand studio, the Chorus publishing platform, and the company’s entertainment division Vox Media Studios, which includes the Vox Media Podcast Network and Epic.

We’re taking what it means to be a designer in media to new heights by building a best-in-class cross-disciplinary design team at Vox Media, from our Product team that builds the best platform for digital publishing in the industry, to our brand team that works across a suite of powerhouse editorial networks, to our revenue team that designs beautiful ad products and partners with our sponsors. At Vox Media, you can be part of a remote friendly culture with people in New York, DC, San Francisco, Austin, New Orleans, and quite a few cities in between. Our jobs are well compensated and come with excellent and progressive benefits including flexible hours, generous paid parental leave, and trans-inclusive healthcare.

Vox Media’s internal brand design team are caretakers of seven powerful digital brands (over 200 million total uniques per month) across a wide spectrum of subject matter from the Verge’s take on technology and culture, to Vox’s pioneering news site, to Eater’s obsessive take on food. Brand designers are responsible for creating and maintaining the visual identities of these editorial networks across all touch points including digital, experiential and print and across an expanding array of new fronts including podcasting and television.

We’re looking for a seasoned graphic designer with experience working with media, journalism, advertising and/or with pop culture brands. You are an exceptional creative thinker with a passion for design and a curiosity about what’s next in media. You are ahead of the curve risk taker with an instinct for what creates an emotional connection between brands and audiences. Your creative instincts are only matched by your exceptional design skills and thorough knowledge of brand design work including the creation of design systems, key art and design across multiple platforms. With exceptional communication skills you have the ability to articulate and sell through your work on the basis of sound strategic thinking, audience insights and behaviors and a distillation of a project brief. You thrive in fast paced constantly changing environment. You are a great collaborator, sensitive to partner and stakeholder needs, and comfortable working in teams, both individually and in partnership with internal and external creative talent.

What you’ll do

  • Lead projects as an individual contributor, design lead or work in support of other designers and leads, in the service of our editorial networks (Vox, The Verge, Curbed, Eater, Polygon, Recode, SB Nation) and partners as well as our business lines and the Vox Media corporate brand, designing key art, brand systems and marketing and communications materials.
  • Design digital and print collateral, logos and identity systems, environmental graphics and provide art direction for editorial visual storytelling reflecting the ethos of our house of brands.
  • Help develop and launch brand identities for new strategic initiatives as the Vox Media business strategy and portfolio evolves
  • Work collaboratively with our editorial design leads to optimize their visual identities on their sites and on external platforms.
  • Work collaboratively with our Product Design team as a brand designer to create exceptional online publishing experiences for external partners and for our editorial networks
  • Create design systems and guidelines to insure continuity and brand cohesion across multiple platforms and touch points
  • Explore solutions across a gamut of visual techniques appropriate to each project including but not limited to graphic design, illustration, animation, gifs photography and site specific installations working collaboratively with and providing creative direction to both internal and external creatives contributors
  • Be an active contributor to the overall vision and direction of Design at Vox Media
  • Provide inspiration and mentorship to other more junior designers on the team
  • Work to build and nurture strong relationships with your stakeholders and partners
  • Enforce and model the expected behaviors listed in our Code of Conduct and our Design Principles

What you’ll bring:

(ALL APPLICATIONS REQUIRE A PORTFOLIO OF RECENT WORK)

  • 5+ years experience working as a senior level designer in the field of media, journalism, entertainment, advertising or any related large scale pop culture brand servicing an audience at scale preferably with a background in more than one of the above fields
  • Exceptional design skills and a strong original point of view with demonstrable high profile successes including but not limited to industry recognition, a track record of selling through work, working on advanced and complex projects with successful outcomes, and work that demonstrates innovation, fresh thinking, and strong visual design
  • A thorough command of brand identity work with experience on both the strategic and conceptual level developing and implementing brand design systems or developing a body of work in service to a well articulated brand strategy
  • A passion for the fundamentals of graphic design and a fluency with typography, color theory and visual expression
  • Able to work independently and proactively with little supervision while taking feedback from stakeholders, Design Leads and the Senior Design Director along the way
  • A strong command of industry design tools including but not limited to expert proficiency in the Adobe suite of Creative Cloud products (AI, PS, ID). Familiarity with animation software such as After Effects, basic coding knowledge of HTML and CSS, and familiarity with web design tools (Sketch, Invision) a plus
  • A meticulous attention to detail and a habit of delivering error proof files at the completion of a project
  • A strong network of external design, artistic and creative contacts desirable and a reputation in the business for working well with creative teams
  • Experience working on photo shoots combined with a knowledge of and relationships within the photography community highly desirable
  • A deep knowledge of the cost of different visual solutions and the ability to bring projects in on time and on budget.
  • Ability to thrive in an environment of rapid growth and lead a team through change. Comfortable working through times of ambiguity and within a matrixed organization.
  • Exceptional communication skills. Ability to present creative work strategically and effectively; Ability to create compelling case studies
  • Strong command of current design trends with a curiosity for new techniques and fresh approaches
  • An understanding of remote culture and experience working as part of a distributed team is a bonus

For more on the things we’re building and problems we’re solving, and what it’s like to work with the Product, Design & Technology teams, see our Product Team blog. In an effort to an provide an inclusive and respectful working environment, all team members adhere to our code of conduct.

About working at Vox Media: This is a permanent, full-time position with excellent benefits including flexible hours and generous parental leave. Vox Media strives to provide comprehensive healthcare options for our employees and to ensure that our healthcare and other benefits are LGBTQ-inclusive. You’ll be joining a group of focused, hard-working, creative people who are passionate about doing work that’s challenging and fun and who strive to maintain a healthy work/life balance.

Vox Media is committed to building an inclusive environment for people of all backgrounds and everyone is encouraged to apply. Vox Media is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, disability, national origin, protected veteran status, age, or any other status protected by applicable national, federal, state, or local law.

Apply for job

items.title: Sr. UX Designer (Remote)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=5, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
Job Title : Sr. UX Designer (100% Remote)

Duration : Contract Long Term

Location : Camden, NJ

Responsibilities:

  • Partner with cross-disciplinary teams to uncover business needs, formulate design strategies and clearly communicate the appropriate solutions
  • Help to create, and work within a scalable patterns and guidelines library and design system, applied across multiple products
  • Collaborate openly and effectively with dispersed product teams
  • Rapidly iterate on design deliverables such as sketches, wireframes, and high-fidelity prototypes from conception to final interface
  • Guide, support, collaborate, and iterate through the design process, partnering closely with various stakeholders to deliver a rich, user-centric solution
  • Perform ad hoc research such as stakeholder interviews, end-user interviews, and various other insight mining as necessary
  • Communicate relevant insights, conceptual ideas and detailed design rationale both verbally and visually
  • Evangelize experience design principles and design thinking throughout the organization
  • Maintain a deep knowledge of cross-platform web/mobile usability standards and common interface conventions.
  • Keep a critical eye, and consistent attention to detail

Qualifications:

  • The ideal candidate will have 5+ years in a user experience discipline within a digital agency, product team, or as a freelance consultant
  • Skilled in taking a project from exploration and concept, through to final high-fidelity design
  • Ability to work and collaborate within a cross-disciplined, open-minded, and creative team
  • Creative, detail-oriented, and passionate about delivering a user-centric experience
  • Superb communication skills both verbal and written
  • Proven ability to work independently, self-manage, and multi-task against multiple, concurrent projects
  • Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.
  • Proficiency in design and prototyping tools such as Sketch, InVision, InVision DSM, Adobe Creative Suite, and other tools
  • Deep understanding of current digital technologies
  • A portfolio that showcases the application of user-centered design in several large-scale, complex projects is required for consideration
  • Experience in rapid prototyping
  • Experience working in an agile development environment
  • Bachelors Degree or Equivalent; in interaction design, human factors, or related discipline

Regards

Sanjeet Kumar

Team Lead

IT BMS Inc | C onsulting. K nowledge. S olutions I

1967 Rte 27, Ste 27 | Edison | NJ 08817

Ext no.1021 (O) | (F) |

Email :

items.content:
Graphic Designer at Bluecode

Remote | International | Part-time

REMOTE · Marketing

DESCRIPTION

Bluecode is not only a mobile payment solution. It’s a place for great ideas and exceptional people.

Bluecode’s vision is to build Europe’s leading mobile payment network and to fundamentally replace the outdated US focused card-based infrastructure, leveraging European data protection principles and direct access to the bank account. Bluecode is accepted at over 18’000 locations in Austria and Germany, from large and small department and supermarket chains to famous events like Oktoberfest.

Watch our CEO pitching at the NOAH startup conference in 2018 to learn more about us: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nUWodPSm0Uk

REQUIREMENTS

We always strive for excellence and are now looking for a talented graphic designer, who wants to help innovating the payment industry and takes our branding to the next level. Is that you? Then we would like to hear from you!

Responsibilities:

  • Prepare graphic materials for (offline and online) marketing and app campaigns
  • Design animated and static banners, vector graphics, images for various social media platforms and email newsletters
  • Create print material for trade fairs
  • Prepare visually appealing presentations for team members
  • Assist with social media postings as needed

Your profile:

  • 3+ years of experience in a graphic design role
  • Demonstrated graphic design skills with portfolio required
  • Proficiency with common design tools such as Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign and Sketch
  • Entrepreneurial mindset with hands-on mentality
  • Excellent and organized working style as well as attention to detail
  • Experience in a FinTech startup is a plus

BENEFITS:

  • A small team with flat hierarchy
  • The possibility to work either remotely or in our beautiful office in Vienna

Salary depending on experience but we don’t want you to worry. We pay what you would get in a non-remote job in Europe.

If you are ready to work hard on a future that makes people’s live easier, then please apply with CV, cover letter and your portfolio.

Apply for job

items.title: Senior UX / Product
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=6, nodejs=8, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
What's the opportunity?

We're looking for an experienced Product Designer to help us support the way businesses, do business. You will be joining a very product focused team and will own design throughout the product development cycle - from new ideas all the way to implementations. If you’re passionate about the craft and process of building an exciting product from the ground up and working with great people, you’ll fit right in.

Who are we?

CreditDigital allows vendors to provide an instant finance option to their business customers at online checkout or point-of-sale. Business customers can then design their own terms to fit their budget and cashflow. We are trying to solve a massive problem in the B2B world and we are very excited to be amongst the first ones tackling it.

What will you be doing?

As the first designer in the company, you will have the opportunity to set up the standards in how the design process works. As a product team, we trust each individual to be autonomous and work towards are shared goals. We are fully committed in supporting one another in any way possible.

Act as a champion that drives product ideas from start to completion: from research insights, to workflows all the way to visual designs.

Sketch and prototype ideas to quickly access viability, and design the fine grained details of interactions.
Iterate based on feedback from the whole team.
Work closely with engineers as they build and ship ideas.

What skills and experience do I need?

We are looking for product designers that have done this before. You will be designer #1 which is very exciting and you will get to set the tone of our product.

Experience designing digital products and systems (styleguides), not just websites. You have helped ship products.
An appreciation of the entire product development process, from problem solving through to detailed UI and visual design.

The ability to create mockups of your designs.
Excellent communicator that can articulate the thought behind proposals.
Able to collaborate with the engineers and the wider company on strategy and delivery.
Where will I be working from?

Normally you will be working from our Angel offices (right next to the station) but we are a remote friendly bunch so you can adjust your schedule as you see fit.

What would I be paid?

Our pay is within the top 10% of the industry, for the matched role and experience, based on London rates. According to the market at the moment, we aim to pay £70,000 for the role.

Salary is not everything. Our benefits are all aimed at supporting a life well lived away from work. We don't offer free beers or Coke on tap but rather:

25 days off per annum plus bank holidays.
35 hours / week. Normal working hours are between 10am – 6pm.
Work from home whenever. If you prefer to come to the office everyday that’s great, if you prefer to work from home 4 times a week that’s fantastic. Whatever works for you. As a team we will make sure you are not missing out by pushing remote first practices. Flexibility to adjust your daily hours. Visiting friends and family in another country, going to the bank or the gym, you only need to have an overlap between our core hours (12am – 4pm) for 6 hours. As an example, you can start at 8am and finish at 4pm or 12am and finish at 8pm.

How to apply?

Where you have previously worked does not really matter. If you have a Linkedin profile, just to have a more general idea, send it through, no CV is needed in that case. Instead, send us through a cover letter where you explain more about your experience. We would like you to express:

What have you worked on that you are the most proud of?
What do you enjoy working on the most?
How do you approach the design process?
What would you like to work on here?

In the interview process we will go through a particular piece of work (your choice) that you have delivered, detailing the approach around it, challenges and learnings. We're looking for a feature/research that clearly outlines the problems you were tackling with your design work. It should touch on the process you applied to tackling the challenges, rather than focusing just on visuals and landing pages. We would like to go through from inception to interactions and the visual design. The work should ideally focus on designing software products.

We strongly encourage candidates of all different backgrounds and identities to apply. Each new hire is an opportunity for us to bring in a different perspective, and we are always eager to further diversify our company.

items.content:
Graphic Designer at Beautylish

Remote | Freelance

at Beautylish

Any

Beautylish is seeking a Freelance Graphic Designer to support our creative and marketing teams. We are looking for someone with an interest in beauty who has the design and creative skills to put together beautiful content, while also ensuring that the look and feel of everything created adheres to our brand style guidelines. Specific responsibilities include creating marketing emails and printed content pieces while maintaining the Beautylish visual standards.

You must be comfortable working with tight deadlines, quick turnaround, and juggling multiple projects and priorities. Though you will work primarily independently as a freelancer, frequent communication and collaboration with our creative team is essential. Above all, we strive to create a truly exceptional experience for our customers—from the first time they visit our website to the moment they unwrap their order and beyond. A passion for creating engaging content that genuinely resonates with our customers is a must.

Responsibilities will include:

  • Designing marketing emails and homepage banners
  • Supporting our international marketing team by creating region- and language-specific assets
  • Creating printed content pieces, such as sampling cards and product brochures
  • Designing layout for editorial articles
  • Opportunities to pitch editorial ideas and photography direction

Qualities we look for:

  • Able to produce high-quality work in a deadline-driven environment
  • Self-motivated, creative, and organized
  • Must be able to self-manage deadlines
  • Ability to learn and consistently reproduce the Beautylish visual style
  • Experience in UI/UX and designing for mobile is a plus

Requirements:

  • 1-2 years of visual design experience
  • This is a freelance, remote role but you must be able to effectively communicate with our Pacific Time Zone team.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Graphic Design or a related field (or equivalent work experience)
  • Legally eligible to work in the U.S.

You’ll love being a part of Beautylish because we’re a group of passionate, dedicated people striving for daily excellence in a collaborative atmosphere. We pride ourselves on high-quality creative assets and offering a customized experience for our brand partners and customers and we’re looking for individuals excited to do the same.

Apply for job

items.title: Graphic Designer (Freelance)
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
*Nimbla* Nimbla provides a first of a kind invoice protection solution so that Britain’s small and medium-sized businesses can continue trading with confidence. We're building the future of small business protection and are on a high growth trajectory. We’ve graduated from Barclays Techstars and we have the backing from a world-leading insurance company.

You'll be someone who wants the freedom to build something different and help us keep the thriving small business ecosystem alive. This is an opportunity to help shape the visual identity of one of the most promising FinTech startups in the UK. We'll count on you to make a significant contribution to our success and will support yours in the process. This is a part-time role and we're flexible in terms of the hours and days. Although the role is part-time, we're looking for someone who's in it for the long run. Ideally, we'll work together on the basis of a monthly retainer.


*About you*
You're a designer with a strong portfolio of work in both digital and print to bring the Nimbla brand to life. You’re used to working remotely and independently — but we'd also love to have you in the office. You’ll take charge of delivering new designs that promote Nimbla to small and medium-sized businesses in the UK and elsewhere, to our FinTech partners, to insurance brokers and other stakeholders. You’ll help us shape the look and feel of the Nimbla brand — the colours and fonts we use, the product images we make, the flyers we print, etc.


*You will*
* Define the look and feel of the Nimbla brand, together with the team
* Create consistency across all touchpoints
* Create assets for marketing campaigns (digital, print, videos, etc.)
* Eventually rebrand Nimbla and work on other big design projects
* Be comfortable working remotely and communicate clearly and timely
* Use tools like Slack and Trello to manage your work


*Your experience*
* You’ll have worked as a graphic designer — we’ll want to see your portfolio
* You’re strong in both digital and print
* You can create a visual identity — from colours to logos and typography
* You can design anything from flyers to website graphics to t-shirts for the team
* You’re excellent with both Adobe and Sketch
* You love typography
* Your designs are neat and tidy


*Bonus points for*
* Being based in London
* Experience creating product explainer videos
* Experience with UX/UI design
* Knowledge of FinTech or InsurTech
* Experience of working within a regulated industry

items.content:
UI Designer at TM Design and Innovation

Remote | Freelance

UI designer

As a UI designer at TM, you will help define and drive products across a wide variety of technology industries. In this role, you will apply your passion for product strategy, brand and craft to influence the user interface design of new products and apps. You will create pixel perfect visual designs for some of the most interesting new startups. You will inspire TM and our clients by presenting compelling product design proposals, taking risks, learning quickly and sweating the details. You will work with cross-functional groups including designers, researchers, engineers, product managers and leadership.

Work style is flexible: We’re open to remote employees and freelancers.

Requirements and skills

  • Independent thinker and executer who needs little oversight.
  • World class visual designer.
  • Expertise in user experience and user interface design.
  • Mastery of software including: Sketch, Photoshop and Illustrator.
  • Clear communication skills.
  • Extraordinary attention to detail.
  • Proven track record of shipping successful software products.
  • Proven leadership skills in communicating research, conceptual ideas, and design rationale, all within a user-centered design process.
  • Outstanding analytic, design, and management skills.
  • Experience designing for multiple device types and contexts (Web, iOS, Android).

items.content:
User Experience, Web Designer at WhatConverts

Remote

About You 

  • At least 4 years of front end development experience.
  • Proficient in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
  • Strong sense for visual design and layout.
  • Ability to create modern, clean designs that focus on content.

Things You Might Do

WhatConverts is a dynamic software company, so you’ll likely get your hands dirty in a little bit of everything. That said, here are some things you’ll get to do:
  • Work with the team to enhance our platform and design new application functionality.
  • Lead design and front-end across digital marketing initiatives.
  • Assist with the support and monitoring of existing systems.
  • Experiment since this is a startup everything can change at any time.

About WhatConverts

For the past four years, WhatConverts has been helping people across the world track “What Marketing Converts to Leads”. A lead can be a phone call, web form submission, web chat or e-commerce transaction. Our software helps our customers track their marketing efforts to ensure it is giving them the best ROI.
We want to give advertisers and agencies the complete marketing picture by easily tracking their marketing dollars to actual leads, so they can best spend their budget.
We believe in small teams making a big impact. Small teams are fast and nimble. Small teams mean less bureaucracy and less management, and more getting the important things done.

The Package

  • Location – Anywhere you want. If you want to work remotely or near others that’s fine by us. The current team is based in Charlotte, NC and Birmingham, AL.
  • Hours – 9AM to 5PM EST (-/+ 3 hours)
  • Position – Full-time position.
  • Compensation – Based on experience.

Location: US Locations Only

Apply for job

DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
Marketing Designer at Netlify

Remote
  • Remote US

Netlify is changing the way people build web projects, and people seem to like it! We are a growing team of talented, thoughtful, and diverse people rapidly shipping features to our customers.

We are based in San Francisco, but over half of our team works remotely all around the world.

We’re looking for our first Designer dedicated to the marketing team! You’ll have a big impact on our visual identity, voice and tone, team culture, and our future. We are a company that enables designers and believes in preserving the integrity of their work, from concept to execution.

And we’re growing. We recently announced our $30M Series B funding round led by Kleiner Perkins’ Mamoon Hamid with Andreessen Horowitz and the founders of Slack, Yelp, GitHub, and Figma participating.

Join us!

What is my role?

You’ll be primarily focused on the Marketing Team’s design needs, working on a diverse set of projects that facilitate our core marketing strategy.

You’ll have the opportunity to:

  • Rethink existing pages and design new pages for our marketing site (netlify.com).
  • Shape and guide our brand across web and print channels, and assisting in developing the Netlify Marketing Design System.
  • Design fun promotional items like Netlify shirts and stickers for our enthusiastic users and fans (and for ourselves)!
  • Help grow and redesign some of our other brand properties like JAMstack.org, our JAMstack meetups all around the world, and a lot more…
  • Collaborate closely with other departments, especially members of our world-class product design team.
  • Influence Netlify’s Design Team by contributing to our team processes, documentation, and design systems.

What are the requirements?

Here’s what we need to see from you:

  • Experience producing high-quality websites in a team design environment for marketing software products.
  • Can craft stunning design compositions; ability to turn wireframes into high fidelity designs.
  • Effectively combine messaging, layout design, and illustration to communicate a compelling visual story.
  • Work well in a sprint-based environment, shipping with an iterative mindset, balancing projects and priorities to meet deadlines.
  • Ability to collaborate and clearly communicate your ideas across the team.
  • Have a healthy relationship with feedback, and you know how to effectively elicit it from a design review session.
  • Have at least a basic understanding of how modern web technologies work and are used by our customers.
  • Pay attention to detail, and you will add your favorite emoji in the first name input field when applying.
  • If remote, can work hours that at least overlap for a portion of your day with The Pacific Time Zone.

How can I really impress you?

Bonus points if you:

  • Have done product marketing design for developer tooling software.
  • Have used and contributed to visual design systems.
  • Have worked in a Sketch + Abstract based workflow.
  • Knowledge of CSS/html; ability to build functional prototypes of your work in code.
  • Are comfortable working in a GitHub based collaboration workflow.
Apply for job

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=4, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=1, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
The Senior UX Architect (XA) leads the experience design process in the creation of new product features and functionality. The Senior XA reports to and works with the UX Director in the development of interaction requirements, use cases, customer flows, navigation systems, page wireframes, and information architecture.

To arrive at the final experience, the XA conducts stakeholder interviews, website reviews, content inventories and consumer research. Through user-centered design and design-thinking methods, they identify user experience priorities, work through challenging scenarios, define interaction requirements and align them to short and long-term releases. The XA must be able to envision and articulate usable solutions to enable our customers to intuitively use our products. The experience architect must understand the nuances and relationship between aesthetics, usability, content strategy, front-end technologies and what it takes to connect it all to the very real implications of the platform. The role includes accountability for on-time/on-budget project performance and managing day-to-day project tasks and the quality of those deliverables.

This role is fully remote, collaborating with teammates around the globe. The Senior XA will work directly with a scrum team to determine their working hours.

Required Qualifiications

  • Bachelor s degree (or equivalent) required; Master s degree in relevant field a plus
  • 8+ years of UI/UX design experience in software, web and mobile environments. Print environment is plus.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, especially as they relate to presenting, articulating and defending research and design decisions
  • Experience with UX within a Lean, Agile development process
  • User Centered Design (UCD) expert and experienced with Lean UX and Design Thinking
  • Demonstrated ability to navigate complex problems in developing holistic solutions for product and its UX ecosystems
  • Must be a vibrant and engaging communicator who can present concepts and ideas to all levels of the company
  • Demonstrated ability to navigate complex problems in developing holistic solutions for product UX ecosystems
  • Knowledge and experience with all various platforms human interface guidelines: iOS, Android, and connected platforms
  • Ability to manage multiple projects and an ability to prioritize and organize to meet tasks and deadlines
  • Mastery of core UX processes like whiteboarding, wireframing, sketching, creating clickable prototypes, producing information architecture, creating user flows, and building sitemaps
  • Knowledge of best practices, trends and innovations in experience design, technology, development, visual design, art, communications design and product design
  • Able to balance business requirements, marketing and analytics with design aesthetic
  • Agency experience is a plus
  • SAP Fiori design experience is a plus
- provided by Dice

About Secureworks

Secureworks (SCWX-NASDAQ) is a global leader in intelligence-driven information security solutions. We help organizations confidently pursue business goals in a digitally-connected world. Consistently recognized by industry analysts and readers’ polls, we are one of the best in the world at understanding and anticipating threat behavior. We see 250 billion events every day across 4400 clients in more than 55 countries, and our solutions work across all the layers of a client’s security environment, including 330 different vendor technologies. Join a talented, dedicated, and diverse team of researchers, analysts, engineers, consultants and business professionals who are focused 100% on protecting our clients from cyber threats. We seek out the brightest minds and empower our teams with the tools and support they need to fight the bad guys and maintain our company’s leadership in the cyber security industry.

Uniquely positioned to adapt as the industry evolves, we are also proud to be part of the Dell Technologies family. We enjoy competitive compensation and benefits packages, and reward and recognize our employees for exceptional results. A constant focus on continued learning and growth keeps our team members engaged and excited about “what’s next.” We offer flexible work options when available and emphasize the importance of work-life balance. We know that when our people are rewarded, recognized, and rejuvenated, we win as a team.

Role Overview

Secureworks is a world-class cybersecurity organization that has just launched RedCloak TDR, a new SaaS cybersecurity product that will enable IT professionals worldwide to monitor and secure their environments. We’re hiring for a UX team that will build the design vision for this next generation of cybersecurity software.

Our team is agile and growing. We are looking for multi-talented team members that can excel in one role and support in others. We need a Senior UX Designer to work hand-in-hand with the UX team, Product Management and Engineering to plan out the design in an iterative, fast-paced Agile development environment. You will be the leader of the UX design team, and ultimately responsible for the design that gets implemented with each sprint.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with User Research to coordinate testing efforts, interpret test results, and incorporate results into design efforts.
  • Evangelize for the user experience throughout product, engineering, and management teams
  • Create documentation such as personas and journey maps that represent the users and their problems across the organization.
  • Work with Product Management to identify design priorities that will impact the end user experience
  • Lead a user-centered design process that delivers well-documented, actionable designs in a cadence that integrates with the Agile development team
  • Leverage user research and collaboration with Product and Engineering to develop design documentation such as wireframes
  • Participate in User Research as necessary to support the Lead UX Researcher
  • Collaborate with Visual Designers to develop prototypes and interaction specs that communicate the details of the interaction design to engineering
  • Build a Design Language System to support design consistency throughout the application,
  • Work with engineers and QA to ensure our designs are implemented in the best way imaginable.

Base qualifications:

  • 5+ years of experience as a UX designer of enterprise web applications
  • Demonstrated proficiency at working with technical, data-dense applications
  • Fluency in best practices for interactive data visualizations,
  • Strong command of all aspects and levels of UX design from information architecture, to systems and workflows, to micro-interactions,
  • Ability to rapidly construct scenarios, workflows, and wireframes that solve user problems in ways that are intelligible and meaningful while leveraging best practices in UI and interaction design,
  • Proficiency in modern wireframing and prototyping tools,
  • Experience working with Agile development teams,
  • Ability to work autonomously — this is a remote position so you need to be able to set your own schedule and follow through,
  • Strong project management skills including the ability to manage multiple concurrent projects,
  • Ability to lead meetings for diverse stakeholders,
  • Ability to communicate the value and purpose of visual and UX design concepts to a technical and non-technical audiences,
  • Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Demonstrated experience in one or more other disciplines of UX Design such as: Information Architecture, Visual Design, Writing, or Prototyping,
  • Ability to facilitate workshops to enable diverse stakeholders to build shared understanding, generate ideas, and make decisions.
  • Proficiency in Sketch, Figma, & Invision
  • Experience working within and contributing to a structured design system.
  • Knowledge of cybersecurity.

Secureworks (A Dell Technologies Company) is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Secureworks are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Secureworks will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Learn more about Diversity and Inclusion at Secureworks here.

items.title: Book Cover Designer
items.content:
Book Cover Designer at Scribe Media

Remote | Freelance | International
  • Austin, TX – Remote OK
  • Contract
  • Design

At Scribe, we’re growing, and we need great creatives to design our book covers. You can see some of them here.

We’re looking to bring on world-class cover designers for freelance work. We’ll start initially on a per-project basis so we can BOTH decide whether if we’re a good fit for each other, and there may be the potential to join in the future as a full-time Tribe member.

We’re looking for someone with book cover design experience. Must-have qualifications are technical proficiency with InDesign, Photoshop, and Illustrator, as well as experience producing print products.

Most of all, we’re on the hunt for an original thinker who can both dream big and work intelligently in order to make great concepts a reality for our Authors.

If you can nail all the above, you’re probably pretty awesome, which brings us to an important question:

Who are we and what do we do?

We’re Scribe Media, and our mission is to help everyone on earth write, publish and market their book. The problem is that writing and publishing books are, for most people, a painful and difficult process, loaded with uncertainty and aggravation. Our goal is to make it as simple as possible, so that as many people as possible can do it. We have multiple ways we help people do this. We can edit and publish an already written manuscript (Scribe Publishing), or we can help people write their book using a structured process with our guidance (Scribe Guided Author), or we can do a structured interview process that gets the book out of them in their words and their voice (Scribe Professional). And if you can’t afford our services, that’s fine. We give away all of our information for free. Seriously, it’s called Scribe Book School, and it’s better than any paid course on the internet.

Why our work matters

Our company was started because a frustrated entrepreneur wanted to put all of her incredible knowledge and ideas into a book, but didn’t have the time to write it or the patience to deal with the frustrating publishing process. So we solved her problem. Her book became an amazing success, and we realized the world was full of these people–smart people who should write a book, but don’t, because the process is so painful. These people want to write books, but don’t have the time or desire to do it the old way, and that’s why Scribe exists: we help people turn their ideas into books that both cement their legacy and impact the world. Our process has worked for over 1200 authors in five years, and we’re growing fast. Our ultimate goal is to help everyone on earth write and publish a book. If we do that, we’ll help create many thousands of books that would never have otherwise existed, changing the lives of millions of people. That’s really exciting to us.

You In? Awesome, here’s the details:

Location

  • Anywhere in the world. If we decide later to work together full-time, you must be based in or willing to relocate to Austin, Texas.

Type of Employment

  • Freelance first, potentially moving to full-time.

Necessary Skills & Qualifications:

Here is the list of skills we believe are necessary for this job. Most importantly, we are hiring based on careful balance of relevant experience, cultural fit, and motivation:

  • Extensive Design Skills: We are more concerned about your design skills than your resume. If your portfolio is good, we’re willing to give you a try, regardless of experience or credentials.
  • You Are Organized & Task Oriented: This is not a job for something who is sloppy with details. You will be juggling multiple design projects at once, and you’ll have to be able to get things done and keep up with your projects.
  • You Are Self-Motivated And Get Shit Done: We don’t want someone who has to be constantly managed. If you only work well with someone telling you what to do, DO NOT APPLY. You must be very self-motivated. There are no lifestyle roles here. We all work very hard every day, because we care about our mission, and what we do matters to us and other people. Authors rely on you. [NOTE: Hard work does not mean endless hours. It only means results. There is no coasting and no hiding here and you will be held accountable for achieving real results. If that doesn’t excite you, this is the wrong tribe for you.]

Pay & Perks:

  • Competitive Pay: $1500 per cover freelance (for paperback + ebook covers; bonus pay for hardcover and/or audiobook versions)
  • Be Connected To A Tribe: You (should) have seen the videos above. We also have a pretty cool set of principles that we live by as a Tribe, you should check it out, because this is the operating system for our tribe, and everyone in our company lives the values and principles outlined in this doc. We interact with our freelancers in the same way.
  • Make A Real Impact: We’re a small tribe (still under 50 full time), and you will be a major part of the projects you work on. Not only that, you won’t just impact the company, you’ll impact the world. Books are one of the very best ways to influence other people and change the way they think–and you’ll be helping to make them a reality.
  • Work With Interesting People: You’re not just working on any books. Past authors include major company CEOs, famous entrepreneurs, professional athletes, and people with amazing personal stories. These are books that change lives.
Apply for job

UX Designer

Company: Legartis
Location: Lisbon, PT
Remote location: Partially remote
Level: Intermediate
Language: English
UX / UI Designer
Skills:
  • Bohemian Coding Sketch
  • Design Leadership
  • User-centered Design
  • UX Design

    • Intro

    We are Legartis, a legal-tech startup helping companies manage their contracts efficiently. We’re growing fast and are expanding our UX team to continue building a product that our clients love, not only because of what it does but also because of how it looks and works.

    We’d love you to join if you think outside of the box, have a grit for relentless user research/understanding, which you execute brilliantly. You like energetic environments too. You know what it takes to design a product that our customers want to use.

    Your ROLE:

    We are looking for someone who can hit the ground running from day one. You will have the ability to have an impact as you’re not only able to create brilliant wireframes and prototypes, you’re also independent and are able to lead a project forward from the discovery, understanding and research phase all the way to defining the UI/UX strategies and experiences.

    Our UX, Product and Dev teams work hand-in-hand and you will be a key element in ensuring consistent sharing and collaboration.

    User centered design has no secrets for you, but you never forget that ideas are balanced with delivering business value.

    You have a proactive approach, enjoy working in a fast-paced, dynamic team but overall you want to design an amazing product.

    Your skills are demonstrated in a digital portfolio which shows conceptual thinking, dynamic user experiences and a data driven mindset.

    Main requirements

    • Help to define the user model and user interface for a new product and their features
    • When thinking about features, you identify and design “growth focused” features
    • You understand text-heavy environments and how to improve them
    • Develop high level and/or detailed storyboards, mockups, and prototypes to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas
    • Creating rapid prototypes to validate design concepts with stakeholders and customers
    • The ability to conduct and analyze usability research, test sessions as well as desk research tasks
    • You represent the voice of the customer with confidence, while understanding the business needs that drive decision making
    • Developing personas from qualitative and quantitative insights
    • You enjoy working collaboratively with developers, product owners and also the business teams
    • Demonstrated experience in designing usable web-based interfaces.
    • Communicating comes naturally to you for any type of audience
    • Very good knowledge of English
    • 3+ years of professional experience designing digital products for web and mobile
    • Deep understanding of information design / architecture, gestalt principles, and user psychology
    • Strong ability to recognize and predict use cases and user interaction, including happy path as well as edge and corner cases, and incorporating them into designs

    Nice to have

    • A sharp eye for detail
    • Proficiency with web technologies (HTML, CSS and JavaScript) and responsive web frameworks
    • Agile, Scrum, Kanban experience
    • Experience as a project manager

    Perks

    • A growing start-up, the team grew 500% in the last year (!)
    • A supportive work culture where everyone is committed to building a successful company
    • A beautiful office in the center of Lisbon
    • Possibility to get options/equity in the company (ESOP)
    • A transparent and honest feedback culture
    • 1-2 days home office

items.content:
UX / UI Designer - Remote - UX / UI, HTML, SCSS - up to £60,000

A fantastic opportunity has arisen to join an innovative software development company as a remote UX/UI Designer! This role can offer up to £60,000 DOE + a generous benefits package.

This company works hard to tackle cyber security issues in our world today. Led by a big name in the industry (whom you may have seen on television!), their team of around 30 develop creative solutions in their approach to address a major issue in tech - cyber security! It goes without saying that the products this company develop are world-class and due to this, organisations come to them from all around the world for their high-end solutions. Our client is now looking for a creative UX/UI Designer to join their innovative, enthusiastic team. The software they create is intuitive and attractive, so the successful candidate will be part of some truly remarkable work.

The successful candidate will have strong experience with UX / UI, as well as the ability to code their designs. This candidate will be contributing to the work on a number of new and pre-existing projects. A keen eye for interface design and solid expertise of design fundamentals is also necessary; candidates should have a passion for the creation of wonderful user experiences. Good knowledge of HTML and SCSS are essential, and experience with JavaScript would be advantageous to an application.

This is a wonderful opportunity to design outstanding user experiences with the latest cutting-edge tools; if you feel you need a new challenge and want to work with industry leaders, this opportunity is something you need to explore further. Apply today for an immediate telephone interview!

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=23, embedded=0, frontend=11}
items.content:
Web Designer at Yoko Co

Remote | Entry-level | International

Location: Remote/Telecommute. International applicants welcome.

Alright, here’s the deal. We’re looking to hire someone to primarily do two things: (1) Design totally badass stuff and (2) help to build it.

Often, the aforementioned badass stuff will be in the form of WordPress-based websites. So, it’s critical that you’re familiar with WordPress and feel pretty comfortable bending it to your will. Experience using popular page builders, like Beaver Builder, Visual Composer and Divi, is a big plus. Beaver Builder especially.

You don’t need to be a hardcore developer to do this job (we’ve got some of those on staff, we intravenously pump them full of caffeine and try to avoid making direct eye contact). However, for you, a working knowledge of HTML and CSS will be fairly important.

Right about now feels like a good time to make a list.

In this job, you will:

  • Design websites, layouts, app interfaces and more. They will look terrific.
  • Help to build/code/assemble these things.
  • Use WordPress, a lot.
  • Collaborate closely with your team members, including other designers, developers and project managers.

And you’ll need:

  • Killer design skills.
  • A fundamental understanding of UX/UI principles
  • Strong ability with Adobe software, particularly Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign. Also, we use Figma a lot.
  • Functional knowledge of HTML and CSS.
  • Experience with WordPress page builders, particularly Beaver Builder.
  • An enchanted fedora that allows the wearer to see into the future.

We know what you’re thinking. “Hey, this sounds exactly like the type of stuff I love to do! In fact, I love it so much, I’d do it for free!” Well, guess what: If you work here, you won’t have to.

That’s right, we pay our employees.

Your mind = blown.

In exchange for your services, you’ll be rewarded with a flexible work schedule, competitive pay, unlimited leave, as well as participation in our annual shutdown (often two weeks off, sometimes more, at the end of the year). Plus, we celebrate most federal holidays by not working.

Apply for job

o Initial Sketch (Quick) then Expand
o First Draft – Wireframe composed of snapshots made up of designs already on the market
o Second Draft – Incorporating Colour, Design and Palette to suit the brand and target market
o Final Draft – A fully composed wireframe published on InVision
• Able to work within an Agile methodology mind set
• Be cost and time conscious and effective
• Be adaptable and open toward continuous change, new projects, new people and learning new skills
• Be able to work in a very open, somewhat casual but very effective team of tech and business professionals
• Be open to learning or have some UI coding experience in HTML and CSS
• Be proactive and enthusiastic about learning and being trained in Xamarin Mobile Cross Platform UI design and implementation
o This is not a purely design role
• We are looking for a proactive professional who can turn around a project in a matter of days not weeks (we will train you in how to do this)
• We offer a long-term career building option for the right candidate:
o Tangible incentives – potential for cash, shares and / or bonus
o Become an essential part of our growing team
o Attend events and expos
• Career progression – we take personal interest in mentoring, training team members to be highly employable and growing skill sets for those with a “Can-Do” attitude.

LayrCake is not a business that writes software, but a software company that creates businesses.
Please see our website for our culture, vision and objectives.

We're ideally looking for a female for this role to balance the gender bias of the company and we aim to turn the candidate into a champion, a fashionista and a role modal for women and entrepreneurs alike.
