tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=5, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=10, embedded=0, frontend=12}
items.content:
Front-End Designer & Developer (Drupal-Focused)

Full-time
US Based
Remote job
Small business
Posted Today – Accepting applications
Chromatic in a Nutshell

Chromatic is a digital agency with over a decade of experience creating websites using open source technologies and a recognized leader in open source content management systems.  We’ve helped some of the web’s biggest brands solve hard problems in publishing, e-commerce, and non-profit spaces. We provide leadership and expertise to our clients through design, back-end development, and automation.

Role Summary
We’re looking for an outgoing and motivated designer/developer to join our fully distributed team. We need someone with exceptional communication skills who would be excited to join a talented and tight-knit team in our compelling saga to rid the world of bad websites. A strong online portfolio of your best work should be included with your application. This role aims to find the intersection of web design, UI/UX, and front-end implementation. We do a fair bit of work with Drupal and other enterprise systems, so experience here is a real plus.

If you’re someone who’s interested in working alongside top-tier web experts, in helping steer the trajectory of a small company, and in joining a unique agency culture, Chromatic is the place for you. More details can be found below:

Roles & Responsibilities
  • Work closely with clients and Chromatic team members on engagements to deliver exceptional designs, code, consulting, and advice.
  • Participate in and contribute to peer design/code reviews and project stand-ups.
  • Evangelize design/development/process best practices to Chromatic’s clients and the community.
  • Engage with the open-source community via code contributions, projects, presentations, blog posts, etc.
  • Estimating the effort required to execute interface designs and implement functionality.
  • Attending client on-sites.
  • The ability to present yourself to others in a way that represents Chromatic well.

The following experience is required:
  • Proficient in designing and delivering exceptional web experiences via HTML/CSS/Javascript.
  • CSS preprocessors.
  • Task runners.
  • HTML5 APIs.
  • Web content management systems.
  • REST web services.
  • Developing responsive web and/or mobile applications.
  • Creation of and adherence to best practices.
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
  • Strategic thinker that often anticipates problems before they occur.
  • Live between GMT-10 and GMT+2 timezones.

Experience with the following is a plus:
  • Strong Drupal theming and “site building.”
  • Object-oriented patterns.
  • Agile project management methodologies.
  • Git and GitHub pull request/code review workflows.
  • Designing, developing and maintaining design systems and component libraries.

Some Other Important Traits
  • Chromatic is a distributed team  – strong communication skills, both verbal and written, are of the utmost importance.
  • The desire and ability to brainstorm ideas, do research, remain current with industry trends and best practices.
  • Enthusiasm, personality, teamwork and a positive attitude count tremendously. 
  • Serious candidates will be sure to include a short, introductory video with their application. Don’t overthink it.
 
What sets Chromatic apart from a typical job?
  • Work from wherever you want, whenever you want:Our office is completely distributed, you may work from wherever is most effective for you. We encourage our team members to work when it is most effective so they’ll do their best work, but we tend to schedule meetings during the North American workday and expect our team to usually be available during this time.
  • Reasonable Bookings:We book our team members with a max of 30-35 hours per week for project work. We believe more than that is asking too much. The other 5-10 hours is reserved for team meetings, community contribution, and professional/skill development.
  • Vacation:Chromatic does not set rigid vacation limits. We encourage our people to take vacation when they want/need it. So long as it is planned and doesn’t interfere with existing contracts or project deadlines, we’re all for it.
  • Sabbaticals:Chromatic offers a sabbatical to all full-time employees after their seventh anniversary. Our sabbaticals are intended to allow team members extended time to rest both their bodies and their minds away from work and outside of normal vacation/PTO time and are accompanied by a sabbatical stipend.
  • Health Insurance: Chromatic provides competitive medical/dental/vision insurance.
  • 401(k): Chromatic provides employees a 401(k) plan along with a 3% employer contribution with immediate vesting.
  • Disability Insurance:Chromatic provides both short and long term disability insurance.
  • Life Insurance:All employees are provided with a term life insurance policy.
  • Donation Matching:Chromatic is proud to offer a Donation Matching Program for our team members. We will match donations to a 501(c)3 organization dollar for dollar, up to $50 per month for a total of $600 annually.
  • Hardware:Chromatic allows our team members to choose the system that they prefer and we ensure everyone has up-to-date equipment/software.
  • Exciting Projects:Chromatic consistently participates in projects with exciting, high-profile brands and some of the most highly trafficked sites on the web; some of which include Outside Magazine, Martha Stewart, NBC / MSNBC, Shape, Casper, State Farm, Adobe.
  • Conferences:Chromatic frequently sends team members to attend and speak at industry conferences. Employees are encouraged to seek out conference opportunities to grow their skills and personal networks. 
  • Company Retreat:Once a year, we gather the entire company to spend quality time together away from our desks – usually somewhere quite beautiful.
  • Streaming Music Subscription:Music is important to us; we provide a Spotify subscription (or equivalent) for all of our employees.
  • Workflow: We firmly believe in a strong, consistent deployment workflow. We insist on proper code reviews on all of our projects. This not only ensures excellent code quality but more so, makes us all better at our jobs.
  • Team & Culture:We work and support each other as a team. We make an effort to get together as often as possible and support each other personally and professionally at every opportunity.
  • Flexible Work Week: Chromatic offers a flexible work week schedule for interested team members when clients/project specifics allow it.

items.title: User Experience Design Lead
items.content:
Location: Remote Remote
Role and job type:   Design / Product   Full-time

Job Description

Seeking a design leader who wants to help make the next version of the internet clear, understandable, and inclusive.

As a Protocol Labs User Experience Design Lead, besides building useful and usable open source products and protocols, you’ll also help build our user-centered design practice and promote best practices in a part of the technology stack that doesn’t always get enough design love (protocols and networking). Why is this amazing? Because design is the killer app for crypto and the distributed web, and our mission is to improve humanity’s most important technology: the internet. We can’t do it without user-centered designers like you! We have a rare opportunity to research and build at the core of how the internet could work, and make its next version easier to use and more inclusive.

Tell us about how you work! You don’t need experience in 100% of these responsibilities, and we’d like to hear about your unique perspective on this role.

Some challenges you could work on include:

  • What does identity verification look like in a decentralized system?
  • How do trust and trust systems manifest in systems where people are exchanging data, instead of relying on centralized systems, and how should we design for that?
  • Technologies and protocols like IPFS let you distribute identical copies of your data across a dynamic, scalable network of peers (instead of relying on a centralized cloud). How should a UI communicate to users what ‘sharing on the internet’ means in the future? How could systems support stewarding data together in such a system?
  • What does a UI kit look like for distributed web apps, and what changes (if any) should we make for the different ways people might interact with the distributed web?
  • We have to talk about this brave new world in ways that humans can understand. How should we build those instructional and communication touchpoints, from websites to tutorials to API docs to GitHub repos?

Responsibilities

  • Zoom in and out. Generate high-level product strategies as well as the practical project steps to get there.
  • Lead projects from a user experience design perspective using techniques such as design studios, workshops (both in-person and remote), user journeys, and service blueprints.
  • Support collaborative decision-making. Tell compelling, research-driven stories to illustrate pros and cons of various options.
  • Show persistent commitment to thoughtful, inclusive, and ethical user research.
  • Deliver whatever’s needed to guide development — this could include wireframes, sitemaps, flowcharts, storyboards, or user stories.
  • Create written materials and visual presentations that are accessible to non-experts but that are legally and technically accurate.
  • Incorporate UX into agile development sprints, coordinating with visual and content designers, developers, and product managers to achieve a strategic vision.
  • Show your process transparently in open source communities such as GitHub, or have an interest in learning how to do this.
  • Lead user research and usability testing
  • Plan and facilitate user interviews
  • Prioritize research projects based on team needs and goals
  • Plan and facilitate collaboration between researchers and team members
  • Plan strategies for outreach to find feedback participants
  • Provide mentorship and guidance to other user experience designers, or people interested in UX techniques, on the team.

Requirements

  • Excellent community-facing and internal communication skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Demonstrated expertise leading design work with cross-functional, iterative teams on time-sensitive projects
  • Demonstrated experience in design research (both generative and evaluative)

Bonus Points

  • Experience in at least one other design discipline such as front end design, information architecture, interaction design, visual design, or service design.
  • Experience working in collaborative, open environments (such as open source communities).

What’s it like to work at Protocol Labs?
Protocol Labs mission is to improve humanity’s most important technology, the Internet. We build protocols, systems, and tools to improve how it works. Today, we are focused on how we store, locate, and move information. Our projects include IPFS, Filecoin, libp2p, and more.

  • As a distributed team, we hire anywhere in the world, and at various levels of experience (entry, senior, staff). We look for people with unique perspectives and diverse backgrounds.
  • We have a great benefits package, including parental leave, contributions to your retirement, competitive pay, and unlimited time off. For U.S.-based employees, we also provide platinum-level health, dental, and vision coverage for you and your family.

Salary range

Competitive

items.content:
Location: San Francisco
Role and job type:   Design / Product   Full-time

Job Description

At Kraken we are customer-focused, user-centered and data-driven. We are searching for an experienced and meticulous Interaction Designer who embodies UCD and will design innovative and intuitive trading and investment products for all of our market segments and personas. You will be collaborating with our talented multidisciplinary Interaction (UX) / Visual (UI) Designers, UX Researcher, Product Managers, Content Strategist, Frontend Developers and stakeholders to help Identify UX problems and hypothesize solutions based on thorough research; create UX artifacts including flow diagrams of user journeys, task flows and information architecture, wireflows, layouts in low fidelity wireframes, prototypes, everything up to high fidelity. Big plus if you also excel in Visual Design; most of our product designers are generalists. conduct usability tests to validate your designs; iterate and refine based on insights and KPIs. In a globally distributed company, we value collaboration and communication; we have regular team collaboration and brainstorming sessions, Google Venture Design Sprints, and weekly 1:1s. Also cross-functional team members and executive stakeholders are just a Slack message away happy to give feedback and learn from research insights.

TL;DR: We need a collaborative, highly-motivated, process-oriented self-starter with an eye for seamless and effortless interaction design and best practices. Competitive salaries, amazing perks, remote work and travel opportunities, beautiful HQ office, stock incentives, flexible hours, and open PTO policy make Kraken a great place to work. If you value having a seat at the table and want to make a big impact on the design and direction of product development at one of the top crypto exchanges in the world, this role is for you.

Requirements:

  • 6+ years of professional experience as an Interaction (UX) Designer with a portfolio demonstrating past work experience and deliverables (e.g. case studies, wireframes, mockups, prototypes, etc.)
  • Strong grasp of Lean UX and User-Centered Design principles
  • Be able to adapt quickly to change
  • Strong passion for Bitcoin and the cryptocurrency movement with a desire to make the best trading platform in the world
  • Ability to give and receive constructive feedback and use it to ultimately improve the project
  • Meticulous attention-to-detail
  • Be informed about current and emerging trends in design, product development, crypto, FinTech
  • Be a team player, take initiative and ownership of responsibilities and deliverables
  • Be an excellent communicator (verbal and written), presentation, interpersonal, and analytical skills; requires the ability to communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization
  • Experience working in a collaborative team and directly with Designers, Product Managers, Content Strategists and Frontend Developers in an Agile organization
  • Ability to manage ambiguity, work autonomously, and multi-task in a fast-paced environment
  • Understand and incorporate complex technical and business requirements into design
  • Mastery with using collaborative design tools (Figma, Sketch, Invision, Zeplin, UXPin, XD, Mural, etc.)
  • Familiarity with project management software (i.e. Jira, Confluence, Wrike, Asana)

Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate cross-functionally with Designers, Product Managers, Content Strategists, Frontend Developers to conceptualize and design innovative and intuitive trading and investment products
  • Identify UX problems and hypothesize solutions based on thorough research
  • Adhere to and help refine our UX process per best practices in a Lean and Agile organization
  • Deliver UX artifacts including flow diagrams of user journeys, task flows and information architecture, wireflows, layouts in low fidelity wireframes, prototypes, everything up to high fidelity (big plus if you are a generalist and can execute high fidelity visual design too!)
  • Optimize the design and direction of different products for different market segments and personas
  • Conduct usability tests to validate your designs; iterate and refine based on insights and KPIs — we are never “done” improving
  • Be a strategic partner within the product organization, as a whole, to identify problems, make educated evidence-based hypotheses, test/validate results and keep iterating
  • Evangelize UX and product design within the broader organization

Salary range

Competitive

    • At Visable Labs we strive to connect demand and supply in the digitized B2B world. As a laboratory for innovative solutions in tech, product and marketing we help purchasers to stay ahead of the game on all platforms of the Visable Group. With a reach of more than 3.7 million B2B purchasers per month, the Visable Group is operating the leading B2B marketplaces in the D-A-CH region “Wer liefert was” (wlw) as well as the European B2B platform EUROPAGES in 26 countries. As part of the Visable Group, we are backed up by a proven business and as a separate entity, we work in cross functional teams, agile and at full speed like a startup. Our headquarter´s in Hamburg and offices in Berlin and Paris make us a truly European company.

    As a UX/UI designer at Visable Labs, you will be part of a product feature specific team and collaborate with product managers and marketers through the entire product lifecycle and create material and assets that will engage and inform different audiences across a wide variety of channels (web and mobile).

    We provide you with challenges.

    • Own the design cycle from the conceptual design, user research, and prototyping through detailed designs and usability testing to the final implementation
    • Together with our Product team, get into our users´ minds to understand their needs and their behavior
    • Continuous iteration on ideas, prototypes, and concepts to integrate user insights into your designs
    • Build a consistent UI and experience across the whole customer journey
    • Develop and maintain a detailed UI design style guide for use across the company

    We provide you with perspectives.

    • An experienced management team of serial entrepreneurs who know how to build a fun, fair and successful company

    And that’s what you should bring with you.

items.content:
Stylist at Modsy

Remote | Freelance | Part-time

PORTLAND, OR

DESIGN SERVICES

PART-TIME (REMOTE)

Modsy is a fast growing, San Francisco-based startup that is reinventing the way we design and shop for our homes. Leveraging ground-breaking 3D technology and a seamless consumer experience, Modsy guides you through a few simple steps to capture, redesign, and transform your home. You receive back a catalog quality lifelike version of your room rendered in 3D that is fully shoppable based on your style, budget, and functional needs. The future of home design and furniture buying is changing and Modsy is leading the way.

*This role is not limited to Portland — you can work remotely from anywhere within the United States!

With the help of stylists within our diverse Style Network, Modsy helps customers visualize real furniture and decor in a 3D model of their exact room so they can design their homes and shop with confidence. Modsy’s Style Network is comprised of a talented group of creatives (we’re talking interior designers, graphic artists, architects, art historians, and more!) who have a passion for technology and interior design.

Stylist Role & Responsibilities

As a Modsy Stylist you will be responsible for designing beautiful customer spaces and helping them visualize the rooms of their dreams. Using Modsy’s designer platform and leveraging your design and style expertise combined with a customer-centric lens, you will personalize each room to meet each customer’s design needs.

This part time, work from home opportunity is great for someone passionate about home design who loves providing great customer service and wants to have fun along the way! This flexible opportunity is perfect for new designers looking to build their skills and a great chance for seasoned designers to continue their practice. From students, to folks with multiple side hustles, to stay at home parents this may be the perfect opportunity for you!

The Modsy Stylist is a contract position for people who can work at least 20 hours per week to create beautiful designs for our customers. You can set your own schedule (knowing Lead support is available between 6am and 6pm PST.)

Required Qualifications:

  • Background in Interior Design, Art History, or Architecture
  • Prior interior design or styling experience preferred
  • Ability to work a consistent schedule of at least 20 hrs a week – you set your schedule!
  • Excellent writing and grammar skills
  • Customer-centric orientation
  • Critical thinking abilities
  • Tech savvy
  • Experience with Auto-CAD, SketchUp, Rhino, Revit, 2020, etc. is a plus
  • U.S. resident
  • Passing Modsy Style Network Certification

Computer Requirements:

  • Computer Requirements:
  • Modsy’s designer platform only runs on the following. Please confirm you can meet the following requirements before applying.
  • Mac: Any desktop Mac, 2015 or later; MacBook Pro or Air, Mid-2015 or later; 8 Gb of RAM
  • Windows: 2015 or later; Intel HD 4000 graphics or better; 8 Gb of RAM

Interested in becoming a Modsy Stylist? Follow these easy steps:

items.content:
*----This job can be based in either our London or Cambridge offices----*

*Role:*
Delivering intuitive and beautiful designs and interactions that our users will love, and make the product a pleasure to use.

*Responsibilities:*
* Work collaboratively with the UX Lead to turn complex requirements into delightful user journeys and interactions.
* Deliver low and high fidelity user journey wireframes
* Deliver high-standard visual designs that surprise and delight customers.
* Foster critical and creative thinking.
* Lead the way on the best-practise user interaction design and thought leadership.
* Help users with their cognitive workload, so they can intuitively complete their goals.
* Oversee the visual design and implementation process from concept to delivery, taking ownership and responsibility for all visual design aspects.
* Write your own briefs based on information provided by the product owner.
* Work collaboratively with the development and design team to come to the best solution that mutually benefits the user and the business.
* Follow a clear design process: Discover, define, design, develop.

*Requirements:*
* A strong track record of implementing a robust, consistent and intuitive user journeys and visual language.
* A compelling portfolio of distinctive work that spans ecommerce, payments, product design and storytelling.
* Confident and competent at managing your own workload.
* Expertise in cross-functional collaboration.
* Demonstrable history of being boundlessly creative and relentlessly attentive to detail.
* Good written English, ability to write product copy where appropriate.

*What’s in for you?*
We believe there is a clear distinction between perks and benefits. Perks are easily replicable, whereas benefits are something that are unique to us and something that we have taken the time to think about and tailor to fit our culture and ethos.

*Benefits*
* Pay reviews every 6 months to make sure we’re paying market rate.
* Participation in the Employee Options pool so you get to own a piece of WeGift.
* Pension scheme (3% contribution)
* A minimum of 25 days holiday + bank holidays (we’re not too descriptive about holidays so if you need more time off then just ask).
* Staff perks with WeGift brands - discounts of up to 12% on coffee, weekly groceries, holidays, the list is endless.
* Flexible hours and work from home when needed - yes, yes everyone says this but we do.
* WeRecognise, where we shine the spotlight on exceptional employees every month who in turn get a £200 award in the eGift card of their choice.
* Personal development budget - well actually there is no budget as we don’t believe in putting a cap on learning new things.
* Generous maternity and paternity packages to make sure you get to spend time with your new bundle of joy.
* Fully licensed as a tier 2 sponsor + relocation packages to help you get settled in.

*Perks*
* Brand new We Work office based in Monument, London.
* A new laptop as standard - no one wants an old one when they need to be doing their best work + all the trimmings you need to get the perfect work setup.
* Catered lunch once a week.
* Monthly team socials (Escape Rooms, Karaoke - everyone gets a chance to choose what this looks like)
* Cycle to work scheme - save some £££ on buying a bike


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

items.title: Online Interior Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=6, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Online Interior Designer at Havenly

Remote

at Havenly

Remote

Do you spend your days perusing the internet for new trends in home decor and furnishing…..and then pinning your findings to one of your many Pinterest boards?

Do you create photoshop mood boards to redecorate the rooms in your house each season?

Does the word “couch” make you cringe? It’s a sofa, people!

Do you constantly find ways to go above and beyond for your design clients, stopping at nothing until they are over the moon in love with their beautiful new room?

Do you want to grow your own design business and personal brand without spending time or money on sales and marketing?

If you can answer “yes” to those questions, then the Havenly e-Designer opportunity might be a great fit for you!

Havenly is an online interior design service and home decorating discovery engine. We are your design BFF, looking to make home design dreams come true for all budgets and styles. Our goals are to make home design effortless, empowering and accessible for everyone!

We are growing our Online Design team! We’re looking for experienced interior designers who are entrepreneurially spirited, client-focused and fired up to grow a business in a new and exciting way.

What does a Havenly Online Designer do?

  • Work online through the Havenly platform to create beautiful designs for clients across the country
  • Source furnishings and decor from a wide variety of retail, trade and wholesale vendors
  • Provides remarkable client experiences – You receive positive ratings on all designs and are constantly searching for new ways to go above and beyond to meet the needs of your clients
  • Stays active on social media as well as in local and online communities to bring awareness to their brand and service
  • Actively follows trends and news in and affecting interior design
  • Communicate, communicate, communicate – Proactively and in a timely fashion communicate with your customers and respond to their inquiries
  • Offer suggestions – Provide both positive and constructive feedback to the Havenly team so we can continually improve the e-Designer experience and help you grow your business

Who are Havenly Online Designers?

  • Experienced professionals – You’re experienced in in interior design, customer service, and sales – Interior design degree strongly preferred
  • Photoshop Pros – E-Designers are proficient in their use of Photoshop and can create a room rendering from scratch in the system.
  • Technically savvy – You are comfortable with new technologies, and navigating online software and systems.
  • Design Savvy – You seek to create interesting and unique, style-forward designs that only an experienced designer could create. You are also familiar with popular US-based retailers and vendors,
  • Driven – You’re excited to work independently growing your own businessThis is an opportunity that you can run with, and we’re here to provide support and resources for all who do
  • Passionate – You are passionate about the interior design industry, your work, and exude that passion in all who come in contact with you

Why you’ll love being an Online Designer for Havenly?

  • The opportunity to run your own business, and build your personal brand, doing what you love.
  • Get matched with a continuous stream of clients, without spending money on sales and marketing, and without having to ever commute for meetings and appointments.
  • Achieve flexibility and control over your schedule. Keep your clients happy, while working where you want, when you want.
  • Be a part of a community of interior designers across the country who share the same interests, passions, skills and experiences.
  • Have access to, source from, and receive trade discounts from hundreds of retail, trade and wholesale vendors across the country.
  • Receive ongoing support from the Havenly customer and designer support teams.

Sound good? Interested? Ready to take next steps? Awesome, we are excited to hear from you!

Apply for job

items.content:
Job Description

Glasgow based Metix is an established and successful medical technology company that is currently developing the next-generation of medical devices that have the potential to improve medical care in pre-hospital care settings. We are looking for engineers who are versatile, enthusiastic and display leadership qualities.

Successful candidates will:
● Develop hardware for an innovative, portable vital signs monitor.
● Develop Test and Manufacturing Plans for designed products.
● Prototype and develop microcontroller based peripherals
● Work with an agile, multidisciplinary team, collaborating closely with Software, Hardware and Industrial
Design colleagues.

REQUIREMENTS

Minimum Qualifications and Skills:

● BSc/BEng in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, related technical field or equivalent practical
experience.
● Strong understanding of Analogue and Digital Electrical principles.
● Understanding of microcontroller and microprocessor usage and implementation. (ARM Cortex, MSP430).
● Strong experience with EDA Tools such as EAGLE, Altium.
● Strong Schematic Capture and PCB Layout skills.
● Experience with simulation tools (LTspice, TINA)
● Demonstrate knowledge of standard embedded interfaces such as UART, I2C and SPI.
● Comfortable assembling and testing SMT level electronics.
● Experienced using standard Electronics Lab tools.
● Comfortable using DVCS tools such as Git.
● Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Desirable Qualifications and Skills:

● MEng in Electronics Engineering, further education or experience in medical technology, computer science
or other technical related field.
● Experience designing complex, multilayer PCBs with HDI components.
● Prior experience working on Medical Equipment hardware projects with awareness of IEC 60601-1 series of
standards.
● Previous experience in Biopotential measurement or other medial sensing principles.
● Good understanding of battery technologies including Li-Ion battery packs in portable applications.
● Experience with Analogue and Digital Signal Conditioning and Processing schemes.
● Experience with board Bring-Up and Debug.
● Strong Design-For-Manufacturing experience with good understanding of appropriate application of JTAG
and other test methods.
● Software development skills with focus on Embedded Systems.
● Experience with Embedded Linux and the Yocto Project.

Benefits:
● Flexible working hours
● Relaxed working environment
● Short walking distance from Glasgow Central Station
● Casual dress code
● 35 hour contract with an hour lunch
● Opportunity to work from home after probation

items.content:
UX Designer at Limelight Health

Remote
  • Product – Remote – U.S., California

Would you like to work at a dynamic startup company as we achieve an exciting new level of growth and success?

Are you ready to join a team committed to our values and culture as we work together to remake the employee benefits industry?

Who We Are:

The Limelight Heath Software Platform is changing the employee benefits industry with its revolutionary SaaS-based, mobile/desktop, enterprise solution.

As a VC backed, successful, private company, with multiple awards, Limelight Health has recently raised $33.5 million in Series C funding round, allowing for further expansion, and continued success. This, along with industry veterans at the helm, and the strength of major investment partners including Wells Fargo Capital Finance, Plug & Play, AXA Venture Partners, Mass Mutual Ventures, and Principal Financial Group, ensures the company is well positioned for continued expansion.

Limelight Health is largely remote with offices in San Francisco, Redding, and Des Moines with a flexible work environment and atmosphere.

Our Values:

  • Do Good – We believe that we should give back to each other, our families and our community. This means being an empathetic steward of those around us and acting with integrity.
  • Grit – Pushing through even though it’s hard and you feel like quitting. It’s having passion to push through barriers and achieve your objective.
  • Own it- We take responsibility and act as though whatever we are doing is our own. We think “what would I do if I owned this, if it were mine?”
  • Kaizen – The Japanese have a term called ‘Kaizen’, which means ‘continuous improvement’. Whether it is our personal relationships outside of work, how our teams interact, how we develop our product, work with our Board, our customers, our partners or others; we strive to constantly improve ourselves and each other.
  • Humility & Awareness- Some call this the no #*&hole rule. We call it being humble and aware. No matter how good you think you are, there is someone more successful, who has a better product or gets things done faster. We strive to be open, authentic and inquisitive; humble. If you are defensive, closed, insincere or think you know it all, this is not the place for you.

What We Offer:

  • Remote work option available
  • Competitive base salary
  • Equity (via stock options)
  • Unlimited PTO (paid time off)
  • Top shelf technology and tools
  • Knowing your product is making a difference
  • Widespread demonstrated appreciation
  • Direct working relationship with original founders
  • The knowledge that investors are using the product
  • Start-up environment
  • Fun, collaborative, flexible, and remote environment
  • Company happy hours and future events planned

UX Designer, Overview:

As a UX Designer in the Product team, you will be critical in designing Limelight’s Enterprise Platform solutions to solve critical business problems. You will use customer empathy and user research to identify opportunities to reduce friction and help users achieve their outcomes. This role also works on client-facing professional services projects to help customers implement our solutions.

You will work with product managers and engineers to design the next generation of LLH products. On client projects, you will work with business analysts and solution architects to extend platform functionality. You will be responsible for defining and applying platform design guidelines to our enterprise customers as part of implementation work with the Enterprise Delivery team.

A UX Designer will be expected to collaborate with product managers and engineers to research, define, and create products that solve customer mission-critical problems at least 20% better than alternatives. You will collaborate with business analysts and engagement managers to support delivery of professional services configuration and product extensions that meet customer expectations.

This role will also create processes, assets, and infrastructure to support outstanding product design, including low-fidelity and high-fidelity User Prototypes, LiveData Prototypes, and Hybrid Prototypes to test product ideas and minimize risks.

Requirements

  • 2+ years Design experience on enterprise SaaS product of moderate to high complexity (e.g. ERP, CRM, ITSM, HRM, Automation)

Preferred experience:

  • Product-related experience with mission-critical enterprise systems
  • Experience in a client-facing consultative role
  • Experience working in agile software development teams
  • Design experience with material design

Factors that contribute to success in this role:

  • Creativity
  • Customer Focus
  • Innovation Management
  • Peer Relationships
  • Presentation Skills
  • Problem Solving

Please do not apply to this job unless you are authorized to work in the US. We are unable to offer sponsorship at this time.

Limelight Health is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

Apply for job

items.content:
Video Editor at Arrowhead Pride

Remote | Freelance

Location: Remote

Vox Media contributors thrive on innovation and change while ambitiously seeking to master their subject areas, hone their craft, and improve their communities. We help smart, talented, creative professionals make a meaningful impact in media, technology and the world around them. The Vox Media house of networks includes industry-leading media forces like SB Nation, Eater, The Verge, Vox, Curbed, Recode, Racked and Polygon, and reaches an audience of hundreds of millions, generating over a billion content views each month.

Vox Media’s SB Nation is the fastest-growing online sports media brand and the largest network of more than 300 individual fan-centric sports communities, including SBNation.com, our national flagship property. Our network is powered by the most respected web-native sports journalists. One part of our network is looking for new leadership, and that’s where you come in.

SB Nation Team Brands are looking for a video editor for our Kansas City Chiefs fan site, Arrowhead Pride, to work on a YouTube channel dedicated to players, moments and events happening around the Kansas City Chiefs. The video editor would be responsible for the following:

  • Producing and editing longform video content at least once a week specifically for our YouTube channel.
  • Developing and making adjustments to video shows or series to help the YouTube channel grow.
  • Work with the Executive Producer and the Arrowhead Pride producer to create content that will appeal to fans of the team.
  • Regular communication with SB Nation management regarding site goals, traffic, and progress.

Our best video editor candidates will:

  • Have a passion for NFL and KC Chiefs news and history.
  • Have strong storytelling skills.
  • Be a self-starter and pitch video ideas regularly.
  • Access to Adobe Creative Suite (specifically After Effects, Premiere, and Photoshop).
  • Compositing and integrating animations and graphics into video.
  • Take responsibility for projects and self-produce/direct when necessary, or alternatively work closely with the Executive Producer to realize a specific vision.

This is a contractor position that pays a monthly stipend. Some daytime availability is preferred. If your background and experience don’t perfectly align with every single thing we’re looking for, but you believe you have the potential to thrive in this role, we encourage you to apply. To apply, please submit a resume, cover letter, and a portfolio/website featuring your work.

Vox Media is committed to building an inclusive environment for people of all backgrounds, and everyone is encouraged to apply. Vox Media is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, disability, national origin, protected veteran status, age, or any other status protected by applicable national, federal, state, or local law.

items.title: Service / Culture Design Associate
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
We’re recruiting a Service/Culture Design Associate to help us develop the way we interact online and offline, with each other and with our partners.

*June 2019*

* Mid/Senior level design role
* Full time. Part time considered
* Flexible location with min. 1 day a week in London
* Competitive rates
* Initial three month freelance contract (we expect this to develop into a longer term role)


*Context*

We, at CAST, have been supported to develop Catalyst, a cross sector partnership community, in order to dramatically increase the digital capabilities of 40,000 charities over the next five years.
Part of this work involves us helping to develop a culture across the community; one that will enable us to work as one team towards the change we want to see in the world. We want to begin that work internally.
All in all, it’s a difficult, fascinating piece of work and we need some help.

*Role purpose*

The Service and Culture Design Associate has a vital role in supporting the Head of Digital Support and Interaction at CAST to develop a deep understanding of the processes and behaviours that are essential as part of our internal relationships, those between us and our partners and those between digital partners and the charities they support.This role will draw heavily on culture design principles to develop a range of processes and practices that will enable our core values to come to life within our work operationally and programatically.

We are looking for a curious, thoughtful and delivery-driven designer to join the team, initially on a three-month basis, to support this work from discovery to the delivery of prototyped guidelines that will ensure we develop and maintain positive, equal and productive relationships across all channels of our work.
CAST offers competitive rates, and flexible working hours.

*Specific areas of work*

* Lead on user research planning and delivery as well as synthesis and playback
* Curate and synthesise key insights from initial desk based research
* Plan, schedule, coordinate and manage interaction mapping exercises
* Identify behaviours that can manifest our values at every level and across all channels
* Design, plan, coordinate and manage tests of specific processes to enable certain behaviours
* Refine processes into a series of prototyped guides for different audiences

*Person specification*

* At least five years’ experience in service or culture design in an agile environment relevant to the areas of work above
* Creative, positive approach to problem-solving
* Good listening skills, empathy, optimism and resilience.
* Comfortable with uncertainty and ambiguity.
* Organised, methodical and logical thinker
* Visual design skills are an advantage
* Team player and ability to work to tight deadlines
* A strong commitment to the aims and objectives of CAST

We’re ready to get to work on this and as such, this position is part of a rolling recruitment process. To apply, please send us a CV/LinkedIn and cover letter and feel free to drop Matt a line if you would like to discuss the role.

No agencies at this time please.

items.title: Lead Visual Designer - Fintech
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=8, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=8, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=14}
items.content:
*Role:* Lead Visual Designer
*Where:* London, Cardiff, Remote

*The Company*
Tired of paying huge upfront prices for flights, hotels and holidays? So were we! So we’re changing it, for everyone.

Awaymo lets travellers spread the cost of flights and hotels with simple instalment plans. Unlike other booking sites, Awaymo customers don’t have to pay for their trip before they travel. We have thousands of customers across the UK using our platform (awaymo.com) to search, book, and finance their holidays, interest free.

Our customer base is loyal and passionate (as you will see from our online reviews), and we are expanding our marketing team to super-charge growth and user acquisition.

*The Role*
We are in the process of rebranding with the help of a top Shoreditch based Branding Agency, to create a market leading brand that will be the face of our revolutionary product. We’re looking for an empathetic graphic designer with a strong portfolio of work in both digital and print to bring our new brand to life.

*About you:*
You intrinsically NEED to create the best visuals to DELIGHT your viewers/users, this is what you live for and part of who you are, anything less than the best is a felony.

*What you'll be doing:*
* Push our visual brand language to the next level
* Working with the product and marketing teams to create assets for marketing campaigns including digital, print, video shorts, infomercials, commercials and more.
* Working with the product team to craft beautiful graphic design and illustrations for our website and app projects
* Create awesome swag, stickers, other stuff to give to customers and team members alike
* Deck out our offices to create a fun, immersive, branded space for everyone
* Researching the latest design innovations to keep our visuals on brand and up to date
* Define design processes and systems that will be used not only by you, but also by future designers joining your team
* Develop a deep understanding of our users - their goals, annoyances and desires.

*What You’ll Need:*
* Holistic visual design experience - you know how to present all aspects of the brand
* 3+ years of experience designing world class brand visuals from swag through to marketing collateral and office decor
* A portfolio of your work for us to get a flavour of your style and quality
* Strong design skills across digital and print
* Strong skills using design software e.g. Sketch, Adobe
* Adobe skills for illustrations and animations
* Be a good strategic thinker and articulate design decisions clearly
* Understand technical implications and limitations when designing
* Be a self-starter and take control of your own work-flow
* Strong understanding of psychology and human behaviour
* Strong, clean visual design sense
* Strong skills in typography and grids
* Love to solve problems and be challenged
* To be a constant learner. Always growing - both personally and with the team

*Desired:*
* At least 2 years of experience working in fast-paced startup environment
* Experience designing for B2C

*What we offer*
* High-impact role at an industry disrupter - you will make a meaningful contribution to our success!
* Casual dress
* Free beer/cider/tea/coffee/water/etc
* Ping pong and air hockey tables
* Team nights out
* Heavily discounted travel
* Fantastic London location with private offices in WeWork

If you are looking to be on the cutting edge of fintech and travel in the UK, Awaymo is the place for you. Please send your CV to careers@awaymo.com and don’t forget to say which role you are applying for in the subject line.

items.content:
Brand Designer at Plato Design

Remote | Freelance | International

Anywhere

Who are we?

Plato is a new type of design agency. We empower people to do what they love from anywhere in the world. Our vision is to blend the best of human creativity with the power of Machine Learning to reimagine collaboration with each other, and partnership with our clients.

We believe that if you hire talented folks, lead with trust, and give people the tools they need to succeed, then creativity will come. Our team is completely distributed, but we’re building new modes of operation together.

Our team leverages technology to collaborate because we want to, dives into deep work when we need to, and (every so often) connects in real life because we like to. With us, you get the opportunity to be curious and collaborate with passionate peers, without sacrificing autonomy or career ownership.

Plato is proud to be backed by Y Combinator and some of Silicon Valley’s best investors. Join us on our untraditional, inspiring journey.

The Role

Plato is looking for a wide range of experienced design thinkers to help us deliver interesting, useful design projects to our customers. As a freelance designer, you can be located anywhere and take on as many or as few projects as you’d like.

As a Brand Designer in the Plato Creative Network, you’ll be responsible for designing brand identities, often going from “0 to 1” in developing new brands from scratch. Most projects will require constructing brand identities by creating mood boards to align direction with a client and crafting visual identities (ie logo type, mark, guidelines) for a client’s brand. You’ll be compensated based on the complexity of the project.

Ideal Brand Designer candidates have a high quality bar, with a portfolio that displays a range of project types, aesthetics and use cases. You should have a track record of success delivering high quality work on schedule, and should enjoy collaborating as a part of a fast moving team. You must also have a “business fluent” level proficiency in written English.

Apply for job

items.title: SitePen: Marketing Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=3}
items.content:
Marketing Designer

Full-time
Anywhere in the United States
Remote job
Small business
Posted Today – Accepting applications

Why SitePen?

As the marketing designer at SitePen, you’ll create innovative designs for web, mobile, and marketing projects from concept through launch. You’ll be responsible for designing intuitive digital solutions and assets for web and social media. This position requires a well-organized professional who is creative, flexible, and has an appreciation for InVision’s email marketing tactics. If you’re good at engaging audiences with beautiful, memorable, and easy-to-navigate online experiences, you should definitely send us your portfolio today.

Your Responsibilities

  • Design and implement marketing campaigns including emails, infographics, and templates
  • Conceptualize and design web pages that enhance the user’s digital experience
  • Design, produce, and deliver outstanding visuals that engage the viewer, drive traffic, and build brand awareness
  • Ensure all designs are consistent with SitePen’s brand guidelines
  • Assist in the design and creation of print and digital presentation materials

Your Qualifications

  • 3+ years in Graphic Design
  • Experience with Sketch, Figma, and Adobe Creative Suite (specifically Photoshop & Illustrator)
  • Proven experience with best practices and industry standard HTML and CSS
  • Proficient with WordPress
  • Expert understanding of social media platforms

Your Skills and Attributes

  • Strong presentation, communication, and collaboration skills
  • Must have a positive, outgoing attitude
  • Highly motivated and a creative problem solver
  • Must be detail-oriented
  • Must be comfortable learning new skills
  • Must love brainstorming and contributing to the creative process
  • Must be willing to take on new challenges
  • Ability to translate projects from concept to completion with minimal oversight
  • Relentless high standards and a high attention to detail
  • Exceptional writing and editing skills, as well as the ability to adopt the style, tone, and voice of SitePen into various types of content
  • Ability to translate brand standards across multiple platforms including websites, social media, sales presentations, and other print and digital marketing
  • Ability to juggle multiple projects at a time while meeting deadlines and project expectations

Job Location

You’ll work at home! Your home just needs to be somewhere within the United States.

Contract to Hire

We are intent on finding a designer who can own and hone our various brands. We are dedicated to hiring someone with the desire, drive, and attitude to join our team!

As such, this position is contract to hire. Initially paid a competitive hourly wage with an expectation of 40 hours per week, we will invite the right person to a permanent salaried position within the first 90 days!

Please include a link to your portfolio. Candidates must be authorized to work in the United States.

items.title: Graphic Designer
items.content:
Graphic Designer at National Veterinary Associates

Remote | Freelance

National Veterinary Associates

Job Description

LOCATION: Remote

JOB CODE: Contractor

ESTIMATED DURATION: Estimated up to 60 hours/month

THE POSITION

NVA is seeking a Graphic Designer who will be tasked with design, development, execution and production of marketing materials to support NVA’s Business Development team and its dedicated service lines.

Principal Responsibilities:

  • Work closely with Sr. Marketing Manager in planning, creative development, execution and production of marketing materials
  • Ensure these marketing materials align with marketing standards/ requirements and follow branding guidelines
  • Lead and/or participate in design concept, development, execution and production of various materials including print, collateral, multi-media, direct, events signage and web
  • Work on multiple projects simultaneously and project manage own work
  • Other design- related tasks as needed

Job Requirements

  • 3+ years of design experience
  • Strong portfolio of graphics or other illustrations
  • Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office programs
  • A keen eye for aesthetics and details
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Ability to work methodically and meet deadlines
Apply for job

items.content:
Web / Graphic Designer

We are seeking a visual designer to conceptualize and build creative assets for e-commerce websites. Assets may include complete website layouts, product promotions, and graphics for social media. The ideal candidate should have an understanding of popular trends in web design, and the ability to create diverse graphics targeting a variety of markets. Coding skills are not required for this role.

Working remotely with a young team based around the world, you’ll have the flexibility to work on a variety of projects and wear many hats within the business. This is a remote position – you’ll be required to join group calls and participate in an online project management tool however the work can be completed from any location.

This is an ongoing contract with part-time or full-time hours required.


Requirements:

  • Strong portfolio of web design projects
  • Excellent design skills and understanding of principles (typography, color, composition, etc.)
  • Understanding of the latest trends and usability in modern web design
  • Familiarity with Adobe Creative Suite applications is a major asset
  • Experience with UI and UX and best practices
  • Excellent verbal/written communication skills
  • Enthusiastic and willing to pitch in wherever necessary
  • Capable of working independently and on a team
  • Attention to detail and excellent organizational skills

Primary Duties/Responsibilities:

  • Design complete websites based on providing assets and strategic objectives
  • Create product marketing assets including thumbnails, landing pages, and social media graphics
  • Photography touch-up and manipulation
  • Monitor the web for new web technologies and potential product ideas

items.content:
About us

Disperse is a VC-backed artificial intelligence construction startup focused on improving on-site productivity with the help of computer vision. Our goal is to ultimately re-imagine the way building projects are planned, delivered and operated.

We're currently working on some of the largest building projects in London (e.g. Renzo Piano’s Shard Place, Wood Wharf) and have grown from 5 to 35 people over the past year. We have ambitions to expand significantly, which means that we are looking for passionate and enthusiastic talent to join the team.

We move at a high speed, and will provide you with immense opportunities for initiative, creativity and leadership. Our proudly diverse, international team is based in London, Sarajevo and Yerevan, and has a wealth of experience from construction management to computer vision and robotics.


Your role

We are looking for an entrepreneurial UX designer with a passion for great products and digital technologies. There is no better time to join our growing team, as you will have the rare opportunity to establish yourself as our first design leader, as you find, onboard and mentor the next generation of Disperse designers across our international offices. Our ideal team member is ready to take on both business growth and design challenges, and is excited to creatively embed design into artificial intelligence-based solutions to solve the age old productivity gap in the construction industry.

Not only will you have a lead role in growing our design function, but you will also be a core member of our growing Product team, collaborating closely with our product managers and engineers right from product inception and discovery through to delivery. Your key responsibilities will include:

Building, leading and mentoring a team of talented UI and UX designers and freelancers.
Owning our UX product design streams, and prototyping your way to validated, delightfully simple experiences for our customers.
Envisioning and implementing an industry-defining customer experience across all touchpoints - both on and off of our platform.
Developing a deep understanding of our customers’ workflows and pain points, through conducting user research, user testing, and running workshops.
Partnering with our awesome product managers and engineers to collaboratively design and deliver solutions that will transcend an entire industry.
Leading the definition, development and operation of our Design System and language.
Fostering our human-centred design culture across the entire business, and sharing your deep domain knowledge with everyone on the team.

Our culture

Ask anyone at Disperse what they love most about working here, and they'll probably tell you "it's the people!", "the team, of course", "the people and the Hedwig owls in the offices".

As clichéd as it may sound, we're very proud of the people we have and the close-knit, family culture we've built across London, Sarajevo and Yerevan. Despite the distances, we're united through the passion with which we approach our goals and the fun that we have along the way. We always look out for each other, no matter what. The following should give you a good idea what type of culture you'd be joining:

We encourage proactivity and taking full ownership of problems and initiatives. We don't believe in micromanagement. Instead, we let you pave your own path and give you the space to continuously learn and grow even if it means taking a few detours.
We support each other. If a process breaks or if you're struggling, you can always count on the people around you and the people far away from you, to help you get back on track.
We run on feedback: direct and transparent praise and constructive criticism, communicated with the best of intentions. There is no other way to learn!
Ideas and approaches are always judged on merit rather than source. We welcome discussions and challenges. This way everyone makes a tremendous impact no matter the role.

REQUIREMENTS

You should apply if:

You have an insatiable passion for UX design and its latest trends, and a keen interest in disruptive technologies.
You own a portfolio that can take us on a design user journey for at least two extensive digital projects and can give us insight into your design process and decision-making skills.
You have 3+ years of work experience in a digital UX role.
You have excellent command of product design and prototyping tools, such as Sketch/Figma, InVision, Indesign/Illustrator/Photoshop.
You have proven experience in facilitating design workshops and managing both stakeholder and customer relationships.
You are well-versed in UX research methodologies including ethnographic research, user testing, usability testing and A/B testing.
You're eligible to work in the UK. No visa sponsorship is available for this position.

Desirable but not essential:

You have experience growing and leading design teams, and mentoring junior designers.

BENEFITS

Pro-rata salary of £50,000 - £70,000 per annum plus generous option package (depending on experience level).
Private health insurance.
25 days’ holiday plus all bank holidays.
Friendly, open and transparent culture.
You'll get to join a passionate startup with proven traction on its scaling journey.
Flexible working hours / ability to work from home.
Awesome startup office in Central London, Fitzrovia.
Free coffee.
Regular socials, and team retreats to amazing destinations (Tbilisi, Sarajevo... Where next?)

Disperse welcomes applications from all sections of society. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other basis as protected by applicable law. If you have a disability or additional need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.


The process
The interview process will involve:

1-hour on-site portfolio walkthrough and cultural chat;
Design case study for us to get a sense of how you tackle problems - completed in your own time;
2-hour on-site interview: presentation of case study with Q&A, followed by technical and cultural chats with different members of the team.
This process should take up to two weeks, depending on diaries. Please note that if you are not currently based in London, we would be happy to speak with you over video chat.

items.title: User Interface Designer
items.content:
User Interface Designer at Baymard Institute

Remote | International

Can you create visually harmonic web interfaces? Are you comfortable doing high-level conceptual explorations one day and ‘perfecting pixels’ the next?

Help us help the UX teams at the largest e-commerce sites in the world.

We’re looking for a UI web designer to be the primary person responsible for the designs of baymard.com and Baymard Premium, our research subscription service.

You’ll essentially be responsible for the interface design of Baymard’s end-user experience — making our research a pleasure to use for the thousands of web professionals that rely on it, all the way from the independent freelance web designer to the UX Director of a Fortune 500 company.

This is a remote full-time position.

Examples of What You’ll Be Doing

Two examples of the types of interfaces you’ll be working on designing and improving over time.

Below are some concrete examples of what typical design tasks would look like:

  • Web UI design. You’ll deep-dive on creating perfected and harmonic UIs for Baymard’s key pages and website elements. That could be improving the aesthetics of pages such as the Case Studies, Annotated Screenshots, Homepage, etc.
  • Extensive visual explorations of new features. Often you’ll be given a project brief for an upcoming feature, and will then be working on exploring the full solution space of possible UIs. A brief could be something like: “Explore a series of concrete design concepts for a new element to be added to our case study pages that highlights the 10 most interesting examples from the reviewed website.”.
  • Optimize the designs of text-heavy pages. As many of our key pages contain long texts (by web standards, at least) — including our Audit Service, Product Page, Research Articles, etc. — even small incremental gains in the reading experience have a dramatic impact on our overall UX.
  • Create interactive mockups. You’ll sometimes make interactive versions of the final design so our team of UX researchers can play around with it and get a crystal clear idea of what the final feature would feel like. These interactive mockups will furthermore serve as a “design spec” for our developers.
  • Quality assure the implemented versions of your design. Following your designs all the way from early idea through final implementation, reviewing and communicating to our developers what needs to be tweaked in order to realize the design’s vision and objectives.

If you enjoy such challenges, you’ll be the perfect candidate.

About Your Job at Baymard

Your job will be building out and refining the UI of Baymard’s web platform.

At Baymard you’ll be working alongside a team of dedicated usability researchers that conduct cutting-edge e-commerce research used by UX teams at some of the biggest brands in the world (clients include Amazon, Home Depot, Nike, Lenovo, Etsy, etc). Your job will be creating the designs for new features and refining the existing designs of Baymard’s web platform.

  • Work – Your primary responsibility will be exploring, evolving, and polishing the UI designs of Baymard’s web platform called Baymard Premium (this is the “delivery vehicle” for all of our research work). You’ll be working closely with the founders of Baymard and our small in-house developer team. You’ll often be starting with already identified project goals, user needs, and overarching concepts for solutions, and then yourself: explore the full ‘solution space’, detail the UI components, present your work to the team, revise your designs based on their feedback, build interactive prototypes, polish the aesthetics, then polish the aesthetics some more, and lastly, ensure that when the final feature is developed it matches the vision of your work and our project.
  • Team – Most of Baymard’s 15-people team are UX researchers. While our research teams know everything about user behavior, they don’t create new designs themselves. You will therefore be the “owner” of Baymard’s designs, and must therefore take joy in leading the design efforts of baymard.com, our internal tools, and most importantly Baymard Premium (our research subscription service).
  • Remote – We want to work with the smartest and most dedicated people around the world, and all of our positions are therefore open to full-time remote work. In other words, you are welcome to work with us from any location you prefer (which 90% of our employees do). If you want to, you’re of course also welcome to work in our Copenhagen-based office (or a mix!).

Qualifications

Excellent UI design skills are a prerequisite for this position.

Specifically, we’re looking for candidates who possess the following skills and personal traits. The numbers in brackets indicate the weighted importance of each on a 7-point scale (higher = more important). These weights reflect how candidates will be evaluated, so make sure your application illustrates your prowess in the highest-weighted skills and traits.

Skills for this position:

  • [7/7] User Interface design of websites — you can perfect and polish all visual details of a User Interface to create perfect shading, page harmony, element proximity, style consistency throughout the site, etc., and make text-heavy pages aesthetically pleasing without sacrificing readability.
  • [5/7] Translating abstract concept to concrete design explorations — you’re able to take an identified user problem and overarching concept for a solution (as text-only descriptions), and then perform a series of visual design explorations of that solution in order to validate and stress-test assumptions around the final end-user experience.
  • [4/7] Ability to do interactive mockups — you can create clickable prototypes of UI designs to illustrate features, flows, and interactive components.
  • [3/7] Quality assurance — you know how to review features once they have been developed, and provide helpful feedback to developers that help them implement the design and project vision; including communicating and collaborating directly with developers to create smart compromises. This is a “nice-to-have”.
  • [1/7] Technical understanding — understanding of technical implications and limitations. This is a “nice-to-have”.
  • [1/7] Copywriting and marketing — can write microcopy and has an appreciation for marketing and how design fits into that. This is a “nice-to-have”.

Traits we’re looking for:

  • [7/7] Independent — as there won’t be any other “design champions” on the team, you must be independent and unafraid to face new challenges on your own.
  • [3/7] Meta-level awareness — you should be capable of doing both high-level and low-level work without conflating the two; in other words, not “getting lost in the details” or afraid to share early first drafts during the early project phases when doing high-level explorations; yet in the later project phases also being capable of polishing the last 5% before a design goes into development. This is a “nice-to-have”.

We furthermore expect you to be fluent in english, comfortable working remotely via digital platforms, and willing to do a few yearly travels for team meetups (expect 1-3 weeks of travel each year).

Interest in UX research and e-commerce is a small bonus, but no experience or skills are necessary in this area as you’ll work with (and have the option to learn from) the best in the industry.

Salary: in accordance with qualifications.
Start date: as soon as possible.

Apply for job

items.title: Graphic Designer
items.content:
Graphic Designer at Last Call Media

Remote

Remote | Full-Time

LCM is looking for a graphic designer / creative to join our team!

Our ideal candidate is detail oriented, self-motivated, and a comprehensive thinker, who can help our teams create smooth, engaging, and innovative digital experiences by brainstorming and converting ideas into visually appealing creative assets.

Preferred qualifications:

  • 2-3 years of experience designing for the web.
  • Familiar with Adobe Creative Suite and Sketch.
  • An understanding of web accessibility standards.

Previous experience in UX/UI and Information Architecture phases of interactive development is a plus. Experience with Branding, Content or Strategy (which could include content writing, content strategy, project strategy, and testing such as user testing or card sorting) is also a plus.

Please be sure to include a link to your portfolio when you apply!

Last Call Media is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, and will not be discriminated against based on, age, race, gender, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or any other protected category.

Last Call Media is dedicated to providing an accessible environment for all candidates during the application process and for employees during their employment.

Apply for job

We furthermore expect you to be fluent in English, comfortable working remotely via digital platforms, and willing to do a few yearly travels for team meetups (expect 1-3 weeks of travel each year).

Interest in UX research and e-commerce is a small bonus, but no experience or skills are necessary in this area as you’ll work with (and have the option to learn from) the best in the industry.

Salary: in accordance with qualifications.
Start date: as soon as possible.

How to Apply

If you’re interested in this position please send the following:

  1. Link to your portfolio (website, Dribbble, Bēhance, etc.) or attached samples of user interfaces you’ve designed or been involved in designing (please indicate your level of involvement, and for large portfolios link us to the most relevant parts).
  2. Other information you find relevant (life principles, work habits, work experience, interests, motivational cover letter, CV/resume, etc). This is optional.

Note: make sure your application clearly illustrates your prowess in the highest-weighted skills and traits listed in the ‘Qualifications’ section, as this is what we will evaluate candidates by.

Send the above to info+kei31e@baymard.com (all applications are kept confidential).

Deadline is July 15, 2019, but apply as soon as possible as applications are processed as they are received.

Sincerely,
Jamie & Christian
Founders of the Baymard Institute

Referral Bonus: If this job isn’t you, but you know someone who’ll be the perfect fit, please send them the link to this page. If we end up hiring the person you referred, we’ll give you one year of access to a Baymard Premium ‘Medium’ plan (a $1,560 value).

Key Work Values at Baymard

The following work values are central to us at Baymard and hopefully gives you an idea of our culture and what working at Baymard is like:

  • Flat organization – Baymard is a small organization of just ~15 people. This means zero management layers between you and final decision. You’ll have direct access to and impact on decision making.
  • Lots of responsibility – From day 1 (OK, maybe day 2) you will be working on final products or services. We believe the best way to learn is to work an actual products and challenges, supplemented with rich ‘early feedback’.
  • Long-term focus – Decisions are always based on their long term impact. We’re not interested in hunting after the next “quick win” — we want to make a lasting impact on the e-commerce industry and usually adopt a 5-year perspective in our decisions and projects.
  • Remote from the ground up – 90% of the team works remotely. We’ve deliberately designed the organization around remote work. That said, we do bring the entire team together for a week once a year somewhere interesting in the world. (In past meetups we snowmobiled glaciers on Iceland, went to NYC, etc.)
  • Team of ‘subject matter’ nerds – Everyone geeks out a bit on their work interests. We love that, and once a week someone from the team does a 20min presentation on their latest obsession — whether it’s quasi-quantum-worlds or the proper usage of hyphens, en dashes, and em dashes.
  • Founders engaged in the product – We believe it is essential that those orchestrating the work of the organization are keenly in tune with all aspects of it. The two founders of Baymard have therefore performed every type of task in the organization themselves (from programming to UX testing), and continue to work directly on the product.

Do your values match those? Then apply for this position at info+kei31e@baymard.com.

Apply for this job ↬
